Reviews.Content: For surfing and email it is perfect. Battery life is good. Screen color and clarity is excellent. Loads quite fast. Outstanding value

Reviews.Title: I like it!!
Reviews.Author: Kirk Gros
Reviews.Content: You have to take your time to setup the unit properly, but once launched the chromebook performs! Best dollar for dollar value in computing.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop/netbook
Reviews.Author: Kyle Y
Reviews.Content: I have had my Chromebook for about a week now and I have to say that I thoroughly enjoy it. It is really amazing how fast its up and running. All of my windows computers take for ever to get going. It doesn't require you to download any anti virus because its built in and it does't pop up with the annoying updates. If you want a fast, light weight computer to get online then this computer should do the trick. Also, remember everything can (and eventually will) be stored on the cloud, where you can access it from anywhere on any computer.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook - Great Product
Reviews.Author: A. Cunningham
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed by the new ARM based Samsung Chromebook. I purchased it for my 4th grade daughter. It will allow her to do all her homework. Small size with great battery life. The WIFI connectivity is amazing. I have a great connection in areas of my house where previously my IPAD could not connect up.

Reviews.Title: Worth it for the Warehouse price I paid, but probably not much more
Reviews.Author: soontobepcv
Reviews.Content: Me: a person who originally wanted a tablet for browsing on the couch.  I couldn't get past the lack of a physical keyboard.Along comes the Chromebook, which for roughly half the original price (and less than a Nexus 7") seems like a great value proposition.  That is, unless you spend considerable time browsing on it.  I don't mind the 11.6" screen, but the brightness (200 nit) and resolution are pretty bad.  It reminds me of Samsung's own Galaxy Tab 3: a similarly disappointing screen, although that is a similar resolution over a much smaller space.  My comparison, I LOVE the bright, saturated display on my Galaxy S3.That said, I would not hesitate to recommend this (at this price) to family members who are not as picky about their technology, or especially if they need a budget solution get on the Internets and want a physical keyboard.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: dubblesJ2013
Reviews.Content: awesome! perfect for internet surfing and streaming videos and music! simple! light weight, easy to pack and carry... super fast! love it!

Reviews.Title: my chromebook
Reviews.Author: Liz Marchlewicz "\Liz"
Reviews.Content: I love this machine! its easy to use and navigate however they still need to work on google docs it has too many crashs

Reviews.Title: Grad Student Review
Reviews.Author: zachbaudoin
Reviews.Content: I started grad school last year and my HP pavillion I had during undergrad finally kicked the bucket. I needed a laptop that would last, at least until I graduated and found a job. My first thought was Macbook, but there's no way I could afford such a thing at the time. Then I heard about chromebooks and started researching them. What I found was an affordable laptop that should never slow down and offered a lot cloud storage (so I can access my work from any computer). The battery life on this laptop is amazing! I take night classes, so each one lasts at least 3 hours, doesn't even phase the chromebook, it could go all night. It's light as a feather, I highly recommend a case or sleeve to protect your investment.If you're a student, this is a great buy. You do get what you pay for because the screen isn't the highest resolution and it is small.Warning to the NOT tech savvy: This is not ideal for engineers, architects, or anyone wanting to run hard statistics and lofty programs. One of my classes required us to do statistics so I had to use a desktop in the library, but could save it in google drive. Cloud = internet, so if you're going somewhere without internet, download notes or documents so you may work on them offline.This product meets over 80% of laptop users' needs. It's very affordable. And it has plenty of cloud storage.

Reviews.Title: Does what it is marketed to do!
Reviews.Author: Joe   L. "Joe L."
Reviews.Content: It is not a PC it is a super mobile laptop.ProsBattery life is amazingNo virusCross platform synchronization - all of your google stuff syncsConsits not a pc, i didnt buy it to be a pc

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Amber Brestle
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook is pretty awesome. I was a little worried with its compatibility with Office and the other programs I use (I'm a college student) but the Google version works fine and I can save my work in any format (.docx, .ppt, pdf) All around, it's a great product. I've spent way more on ultra portable lap tops in the past and this one is better by far. The only thing I could recommend it to buy a case for it. The outside is a softer plastic and scratches very easily.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Galleta "Galleta"
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what I thought it would be...very portable and efficient.  Great little notebook at a perfect price...buy it, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my Child
Reviews.Author: Jean H.
Reviews.Content: I was planning on buying an apple computer for my daughter and noticed this on sale on Amazon.  We have been using it since Christmas and we love it.

Reviews.Title: Good for Surfing!
Reviews.Author: Sean Butler
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my 12 year old, he already has a Nexus and this goes great with that. The download is fast and he can surf really quick. It does not accept Minecraft easily ANC that's a bummer as it one if his favorite games.

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: Canoe
Reviews.Content: I've had my Chromebook since May 2013. I wanted to wait until I'd had it awhile to write a review. While I do wish it had more than one standard USB port, the webcam isn't the greatest and of all things, I sometimes miss the delete key but overall, I really like this computer. I use it a lot, take it everywhere and have rarely had any trouble with it and what trouble I've had has never been anything that couldn't be solved by closing some tabs or, at the most, restarting it. It has no problem picking up wi-fi signals most anywhere I am and that's been really helpful, much more so than trying to work on my phone.It's incredibly light and compact. As others have said because it has a solid state hard drive, there's no fan, so it's also incredibly quiet and while it does get warm during extended use, even if I'm using it all day, it never gets as hot as previous laptops did after even short periods of use. It keeps my lap about as warm as the average house cat, as opposed to burning my legs after twenty minutes.I frequently watch Netflix on my Chromebook. It keeps up, even if I have other tabs open. Usually, if anything goes wrong, it's Netflix and not the Chromebook. I've notice YouTube will occasionally get glitchy if I try to multitask while watching a video. The same can be said of Bandcamp but as far as streaming music from my Google Drive while typing or doing research, it usually works without any trouble. That said, the cloud storage aspect took some getting used to. I've learned to use the Scratchpad (Chrome OS equivalent of WordPad in Windows) rather than Google Docs to get my ideas out, so that I can access stuff even if I don't have internet and then when things are closer to being finalized, I use Docs to format everything and do my final drafts. With Sync, it uploads my Scratchpad files to my drive, so I can access them from my phone and other computers, as well.The app system is pretty good. I've yet to pay for an app and I have been able to find most anything I could need and install it quickly. There are lots of similar apps, so sometimes it's a matter of trying two or three and seeing which suits my needs. Some run internally, others open in the browser and connect online. Some of the latter can take awhile to load. It's not dissimilar to Android in that way. For all I know about computers and smartphones, it could be exactly the same.If anyone has any questions, I'd be happy to do my best to answer them. I really want to thank everyone who reviewed their Chromebook here because I read so many reviews before I decide to buy one and they really helped me make up my mind. I'm very glad I purchased this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent cheap system, especially the keyboard
Reviews.Author: Randy Prakken "airpor41"
Reviews.Content: I just realized I have owned this for 11 months and I use it several hours a day -- whenever I'm not at my desk, like right now in my recliner.  Must be time for a review.The keyboard layout is great.  I wish I could get the same on my desktops.  All the useless (to me) keys are removed and the big ALT key makes shared key operations easy.  PgUp & PgDn replaced with Alt up and down.  DEL replaced with ALT backspace.  All very intuitive and easy to use.  ALT mouse pad tap = right mouse button -- took me a long time to get good at double tap before I realized I could do it this much easier way.  Smaller keyboard with fewer bigger keys -- excellent.Other excellent points:- Thin and very light -- easy to carry and use most anywhere- Excellent battery life- Boots so fast, leaving it off really helps the battery life- Clear screen of perfect size and resolution for a small system- Developer mode gives plenty of flexibilityWorst points:- Initially, YouTube wouldn't work but it's fine now.- VPN doesn't work but I moved to SSH tunnels using the Secure Shell App and that works fine.- Screen contrast reduces at low brightness but I'm used to it.- A little flexible mechanically but, again, it's cheap.  I just don't flex it.I miss Windows File Explorer the most but I'm getting over that too.If you remember what this system is for and understand that you must use the Google environment, including documents, then it is an excellent system for the money.

Reviews.Title: Had to return
Reviews.Author: C. Ward
Reviews.Content: The cursor did not work. Google customer service and I could not fix. Ok, things happen. What is good to note is that that Amazon made the return process so easy it was amazing. I printed the label and left the package outside before I went to work the next morning. They had already ordered the replacement and I had it in two days. BTW, the new one I received works fine.

Reviews.Title: A Great Laptop Replacement
Reviews.Author: Joseph E. Dever "JDever"
Reviews.Content: While the Samsung Chromebook won't do everything a laptop will do, after using it for a month, I've found it's almost as good. And for the price, you can't beat it.First, the good. It's relatively cheap. It's extremely light, and I can carry it anywhere. It's no heavier than a typical tablet. It's a very sharp looking little machine. As everyone says, you open it up, and it automatically starts right up in no time at all. No bloated and expensive operating system to load here. The screen size suits me fine, and the sound is okay. There's only 16G of storage, but with with an SD card slot and two USB connections, you really have as much storage as you need. Need more storage? Just buy another SD card.It's Google-centric of course, so you're automatically signed into all your Google accounts - gmail, youtube, drive and so on. Obviously, nothing is truly secure and private in the cloud, but I find using Drive for writing documents to be extremely convenient. No need to worry about losing anything, it's always up there in the cloud. I can get to my documents from my phone, my Nexus, or any connected computer, anywhere I go. You can also work on your documents if you happen to be offline, and it will auto-save locally and update to the cloud as soon as you're connected again. Again, really convenient.Like most people, I often use my computer to surf the net. I've been using Chrome for a long time, and it works well on the Chromebook, naturally. It's also easy to view photos with the Chromebook, whether your pictures are on an SD card, or on the Chromebook drive.As quickly as the Chromebook starts, it's just as quick shutting down. No need to twiddle your thumbs waiting for the OS to do its housekeeping. So far, the battery seems to be more than adequate. No problem there.So far, the only negative (and the only reason for just 4 stars) is printing. I haven't been able to get my Chromebook to work with my printer, and I don't think Cloud printing will be of any use for me. If I could print with my Chromebook, it's an easy 5 stars.  I do use Eclipse to develop software, and the Chromebook isn't able to run Eclipse. Not a problem though.This is a great little machine, and for the price, can't be beat. I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: For the money, totally worth it
Reviews.Author: Paul Venezia
Reviews.Content: I had a Macbook Pro and finally died on me. I didn't want to spend that much money on another laptop that I primarily only use for web, email, music, and pictures. So I heard good things about the Chromebook, so I decided to give it a try. I couldn't be happier.Positives: The keyboard is comparable to the Macbook, it has the same feel, and love that each key is spaced out and not crammed all together.  It is lightweight and for being smaller, it still feels very durable. Lastly it does not heat up, which is amazing when it is on my lap for the majority of the time.Negatives:The picture is not has HD or clear as the Macbook.  The speakers are not great on this, but I mean I hook up side speakers to it anyway if I want to listen to music. If you are just watching something on YouTube it serves its purpose. But if you are in a room full of people, the volume isn't great.Overall I would highly recommend this for the money! Great purchase. Have had it about 2 months now and love it!

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Julie M Gowins
Reviews.Content: Love it so far...it will just take some getting use to the format.  I love that you can just add apps like on your phone

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: James Maleski
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for my sister last year, she loves it and it is still working great. I bought my second one last month for my mom, who uses it just to browse the internet and check emails, it's user friendly and she is using it daily now.

Reviews.Title: What a great little computer
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: This is the best buy I've made on Amazon. I love the battery life, the fact that there is no security software required, and how my friend and I can work on her novel REAL TIME on google docs. Great little machine, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I needed
Reviews.Author: Alexander K. McGlade "Alexander M"
Reviews.Content: I needed something to take notes in class and be able to remote back to my home computer. This does both and well.

Reviews.Title: It is light, VERY sturdy, and it works well online and is useful offline for editing images and creating text files
Reviews.Author: Mark J. Boyd
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying my Chromebook. I'm currently using it for web browsing, email, and simple image processing, but this fall, I took it with me on a cross USA bicycle tour where I also used it to create web pages - 45 of them - on the crazyguyonabike.com web site. Without wifi, I used Pixlr Touch Up to edit and re-size images for my web pages and Text to create the text for the pages. Then, when I had wifi, I used Chrome to upload the text and images and edit the web pages after crazyguy  created them using my images and text.My tour was from North Carolina to California. Roughly in the middle of the tour, in Norton, Kansas, I dropped my Chromebook. I was in line at a McDs, getting a snack. My Chromebook was tucked under my left arm. Ir slipped out and fell about four feet to the tile floor. It hit on one corner, bounced several times and clattered to rest on the floor. As I picked it up, some one said "Did it break?" and I replied, "I don't know." After I got my snack and sat down. I opened it and saw no damage, so I turned it on and used it to check my email.After I got to my motel that night. I noticed that many of the clips that hold the the plastic shells around both the display and the main part of the computer were opened. I carefully worked around both shells, pressing them back together and all of the  clips that were open clicked back into place. The only damage I could fine was a little marring, about 1/4" wide, on the front left corner. I don't think any of the many laptop computers I have owned, including several Toughbooks, would have survived that fall with so little damage.Since I use it for photo editing, I wish it had more accurate color rendering on its display. Since I camp sometimes on tour and may be away from power outlets for several days, I also wish it had a swap-able battery so I could carry a spare. Its battery is replaceable, but that requires removing the bottom shell and unscrewing six screws which I wouldn't want to do on tour. Battery life is good - around six hours - and I carry an Anker external battery brick which can power the Chrome book for another four or five hours. That is good enough for me to create several days of web pages off line when I am camping.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Laptop I no Longer need Windows PCs
Reviews.Author: Tony Coppola
Reviews.Content: If you use Google chrome as your browser you will be a big fan of this Laptop. Questions to ask first, What do you use your Laptop for? Facebook? Pinterest? Twitter? Online Banking? Typing Word Or Excel Documents? Web Browsing? Shopping? Do you have WIFI? If so you can do it all for this for $230.00, incredible. Who needs Windows? I do for my business, (but not with this Laptop) yes I need Microsoft Word, also Excel, if you want a great Laptop cheap that out runs any Windows Laptop you have it here. My Word and Excel Solution? Office 365 with Skydrive,  (Or Google Drive with Google Docs )I can do anything in MS Office with this Laptop that I can do on any of my Windows based Laptops. (I can access my docs anywhere anytime with any PC using WIFI) Yes you need Wifi, so what, if you don't have access to it via your Smartphone (Hotspot) or at your home or office this Laptop will be a bit useless, but so wont most others at this day and age..... you can still download docs to this PC and work offline.  Printing using Google Print is extremely easy to setup and use, Google guides you through the process. I run my whole business on it now, haven't used my Windows 8 PCs (1 Tablet 1 PC recently purchased at a much larger expense) or my old XP PCs why? Simply, this runs faster. I let my wife use it....big mistake, had to buy another as she loved it so much she kept it. This is so much faster, the Dual core chip makes this run smooth and fast and guess what? No Blue Screens. I have had this a month, not one crash. It boots in about 15 seconds from opening the lid. Its lightweight, great for travel. I have used it seriously for 5 hours on battery and it still had a charge left. I recommend this highly to anyone who has Wifi.

Reviews.Title: Great - If You're A Computer Illiterate
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: OK - here's my take on this product.  Pros:  Small, light, comes on quickly, is basically Linux with a Chrome overlay (so it's pretty much virus free), great battery life.  Now cons:  Keyboard lacks some pretty vital keys (delete for one), too many keyboard shortcuts (you can't remember them all), touchpad is 'quirky' (and I'm being kind here - it sucks!), screen is dim (even at max brightness), needs more memory and a bigger hard drive (the cloud isn't my favorite for storing personal info).  Overall, if you've never used a computer, this is a nice intro devise.  For experienced users, it's not worth the time or trouble to get (basically) a tablet with a keyboard for around $250.  I got this to see what the spin was all about.  Now, I guess I can gift it to my grandkids come Christmas 'cause I sure don't have a use for it.....

Reviews.Title: Xmas flop
Reviews.Author: E. Wyatt "starcturus"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of the cheap chromebooks for Xmas last year.  Seemed great at first:  easy setup, opened almost instantly, fast downloading.  BUT it was downhill from there.  The cheap hardware is a problem:  some keys stick, other keys have to be pushed extra hard, typing too fast makes it jump to another page, overheats in a few hours and locks up.  It's streamlining means it's missing some keys; you have to remember and use combinations instead.  This includes the delete key--kind of an important key for me--very irritating!  When it gets hot after a few hours, weird things happen, s.a. when I use the touchpad, the whole page moves instead of just the cursor; the cursor keeps changing shape and function on its own; can't scroll up and down; finally it freezes and google has to reboot.  This is the worst computer I've ever owned!  Speed is its best quality, but that doesn't count for much when I have to turn it off because it keeps freezing.  If you want a cheap computer that you only want to use for an hour or two at a time, chromebook may be fine, but for surfing for hours, don't waste your money.  Get something better made.

Reviews.Title: No Java
Reviews.Author: A Reinarz
Reviews.Content: The screen is small and you cannot download Java.  I would like to use this computer for online banking but without Java it is pretty much useless.  If you just want to use it for e-mail and browsing it is fast.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful computer to use but.....
Reviews.Author: PCViewer
Reviews.Content: Its been about a month and a half with this.Pros: Light (very light)  Useful for mainly online surfing and word processing with Google docs  Battery life - Its very long, but it also depends on your internet usage. I can vary from 4-7 hours (7 rarely) depending on what I am doing.Cons: Be very careful with how you handle this Chromebook as the SD card "door" can be broken. As I tend to be a bit rough with my computers I did not notice it until later. Make sure to have this Chromebook in a computer sleeve at the very least.  Heat - If you're going to be a bit heavy on the internet usage, it tends to become a bit warm (not too hot). It not that noticeable but if you're going to be having this on your lap it may become apparent. Remember that this has no cooling (given the size it would be rather difficult).Overall: A great computer for the price, while there is a minor issue with the heat (the SD card "door" issue being a my issue) it gets the job done for general online purposes and some offline (for just documents from the Google drive of the account). I don't find the size of the SSD to be an issue (as most of the things that I do on this is done online).

Reviews.Title: Excellent small computer!
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  I have no complaints.  I bought the wi-fi version, so can only connect when wi-fi available.  I use it mainly for school.  I have another laptop that I use for writing papers using word.  It's perfect if all you want is to surf the internet and e-mail.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Randy Johnson
Reviews.Content: As a strong Google Services lover this was the ideal laptop for me.  I am a web programmer and was able to find addons for everything I need.  SSH, FTP via online web editor, sql editor, RDC... and it supports a mouse.  The best part it is just big enough you can type comfortably on it.  Something that cannot be said for my old dell mini netbook... When people say it is just a Chrome browser they are not kidding....  There is a desktop with a taskbar with icons to different Google Services and that is it.  You cannot go wrong for the price!

Reviews.Title: Overall a good machine...
Reviews.Author: Kevin Bolkovatz "myopinion"
Reviews.Content: I have had this device for about a week and it is very nice. Lightweight, compact and easy to use. Google has done a great job at the Chrome OS. The only thing I do not like is the power connector. The union between the cord the the PC is so tiny I know it will break soon. I am hoping Samsung will beef this up! Apple did a nice job with their magnetic connector, perhaps they could create something similar (without patent issues of course!) I am probably going to get two more of these for my kids for Christmas. Would be a great school tool!

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: Cathy Earnshaw
Reviews.Content: I asked for a small laptop for my birthday. I have an Ipad, but I wanted a laptop I could create docs on, surf the net, and check email easily. My Ipad can do all of this, but I missed the feel of a keyboard and laptop. I love this little thing. Very portable, inexpensive and it does just what I need it to. My childrens school issues one of these to each of their middle schoolers, and that is how I found out about them. My son is not fond of it, because he wants to game and such. My daughter loves hers. A lot of reviewers complain about the screen breaking, so far mine has not, and my daughter has had hers since August, with no issues of crashes or breaking screens. I am not too tech savvy, and am pretty low maintenance when it comes to computers, so if you are like me, you will love this. Keep in mind it is a 250.00 computer, so don't expect a Mac. Other things - I can watch Netflix (although the resolution isn't as good as my Ipad), Hulu, Youtube, and I love google docs. Pandora also works great (external speakers recommended). There is a long battery life, and it seems to charge fairly quickly when the battery runs down. This is overall a great small laptop to take to Sbucks, use at home, or at school.

Reviews.Title: Web-based computing; great if you don't need to run Windows.
Reviews.Author: LS650 "B. Clarke"
Reviews.Content: A Chromebook runs the Chrome web browser sitting on top of a Linux core.  If the bulk of your computing takes place in a web browser, you will find the Chromebooks meet your needs.  If you need to run specific Windows-based software, this is probably not the computer for you.That said, I find my Samsung runs Chrome fairly fast, about the same as a decent Window-based laptop with a fast Internet connection.  There are a growing number of "offline apps" now, so you can do many functions if no Internet is available:  word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, file operations including videos and music, e-books, e-mail editing, games, etc.I like the full-size keyboard and the track-pad.  The screen is 11 inches on the diagonal, and the speakers are loud (though a bit tinny).  The display is crisp and clear; the surface is a dull matte finish which I strongly prefer over the glossy, glaring surface that most screens seem to have these days.  Wireless connection was extremely simple to set up, and connection strength seems very good.  There are ports for an SD card, USB 2 and USB 3, and HDMI.The weight is only a little over 1 kilogram, and I find that the battery life is pretty decent - about 6 hours of web-browsing.  I read some comments from folks who say the shell is `creaky', but I find the construction and materials to be reasonably solid - about the same as any other sub-$500 laptop.I think it is the ideal device for someone who would be okay with a tablet, but wants a full-size real keyboard rather than touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: VincenTooC
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping, low price and great quality! This is a great replacement of iPad if u dont need to have so many apps and just need internet surfing.

Reviews.Title: Works for me!
Reviews.Author: Nina Bohuslawsky
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what I wanted to purchase as far as a computer. I have a desk top at work and really do not have use for spreadsheets and microsoft programs at home. This is easy and user friendly. I would recommend it for anyone who just likes to browse the web.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my wife
Reviews.Author: Mike McCullough
Reviews.Content: My wife needed a computer to check her e-mail, facebook, browse the internet, and type simple documents.  This Chromebook is perfect for her.  She loves it.Nice quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for writers on the move
Reviews.Author: Mark Bouton
Reviews.Content: I like the Chromebook a lot. It's very light and portable, but the keyboard is easy to use. It has good graphics and brightness and volume features. It's easy to work on several files at once. The automatic save feature is great, and it's good to know that one's work is saved in the cloud and can be accessed from any computer.The Chromebook is simple to transport, and its long hours of saved battery time make it easy to take various places in your home or  other locations without the need to keep it plugged in or charged.I would recommend the Chromebook for writers and students and businessmen on the move. It's portability is terrific. And it's quite easy to use. Also, the backup people respond quickly and accurately to any questions or problems you may experience.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product
Reviews.Author: Suzy's Soapbox
Reviews.Content: This `laptop' is NOT your traditional laptop. It looks like a laptop...it feels like a laptop..but when you purchase it, you DON'T install software, you DON'T install virus protection (nor buy it!), you DON't wait forever for the machine to `boot up' and you DON'T shell out a ton of money. It is a different animal than Windows or MAC. This computer simply runs a browser - Chrome! Okay, so you're saying, "Has she NOT heard of a tablet?!". Yes, tablets are the best, but not when you want to type emails or write documents. There are apps for games and and apps for creating documents and slides. IT doesn't have much of a hard drive, but additional storage is free of charge for a reasonable amount of storage in the Google Cloud. The keyboard on this machine is amazing - I am a fast typist, and I don't miss a beat. It is not like the compact keyboards on notebooks - people compare the keyboard to the Mac book Air.I've had this for about a week, and I LOVE it. The browser is lightening speed. I finally have a machine that doesn't frustrate me with hourglasses, locking up, etc...The average consumer uses their `laptop' for surfing the net, social media, shopping, paying bills, writing emails, writing resumes and the occasional letter. The prices hover around $250 for a fantastic piece of equipment. This is all you need! It's `okay' to have a laptop that offers nothing but pleasure without the hassles of buying your virus protection and worrying about renewals ...I'm SO excited to have heard about this, so I thought that you should know about it too. I read the reviews, and most people agree with me. See my reviews at: [...]

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done.
Reviews.Author: KrasnayaBelka
Reviews.Content: I bought this for school because of the light weight, long battery life, and price point. So far it's functioning exactly how I want--I've used it to look at readings in class, take notes for a student org meeting, and kill some time in the library.Being a regular computer user, I am finding the touchpad and scrolling system to not be as intuitive as I am used to, but it's not difficult to learn.The one downside for me is that there isn't enough offline functionality--I realize that that's kind of the point of the chromebook, but I would like to be able to do one or two basic things without having to be connected to the internet. If I want to work on a paper but I can't get wireless access for whatever reason, this thing is basically a brick (a sleek, shiny, lightweight brick to be sure) rather than a sophisticated piece of technology.I would recommend this product to someone that maybe wants a supplementary computer for greater portability and basic functionality, but probably not for someone that doesn't have access to any other computers at all.

Reviews.Title: Quick & Convenient.
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: Some glitches initially with the sync feature, but I reset it and its working like a charm. I love that it powers up immediately. This is a secondary device as I already have a laptop, iPhone 4, and iTouch. However, its great for campus life (I'm currently a Senior in undergrad and got it for continued use through law school). Size is great, very light, has the feel of a MacBook Air without the sticker price.Drawbacks: You can't download iTunes, no drive because its a netbook. Also speaker wise, it doesn't get very loud if streaming or playing music, even on highest setting. Must have Wi-Fi! or its pretty useless.Pros: Doesn't get hot even after extended use. Good battery life, quick to charge. Works well as a secondary computing device. Great for meetings, campus life, or coffee-house writing!

Reviews.Title: What the...screen?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love my Chromebook. Great for the value. I use it all the time. Just don't touch the screen. Ever. Don't tap it, don't mess with it, don't even try to clean it. It will break. I've replaced the screen twice and the replacement is $50 and tedious or $125 - half the price of the computer itself. Just don't buy this for a kid.

Reviews.Title: Runs like a laptop that costs 2-3 times as much. with update.
Reviews.Author: Matt Lewis Reese
Reviews.Content: UpdateSo I commented on this in my original review but the screen is quite bad on this Chromebook. It has bad viewing angles I find it hard to fine one that works well. There is a part of me that wishes I shopped around and spent $100 on a Chromebook with a better screen (they would have other drawbacks of course). But I bought the Chromebook mainly for one task  and that was budget google docs which the Chromebook does well.I bought a chromebook because I did not want to spend $1000 on a new laptop and everything below that price always seemed like a rip off. They would have nice specs, but crappy screens, etc. I bought the chromebook because just about everything I do is in chrome and I have a desktop at both home and work if I need to do heavy typing.I do plan to use this to take heavy duty notes when I observe teachers (I am a high school admin.) but have not done so yet and will update this review when I do.ProsScreen has good viewing angles, much better than I expectedVery lightMassive battery lifeTurns on fastI have not found a website that the chrome book has had anymore issues loading the chrome does on a computer.Offline mode works great for google docsFriend of mine logged onto their office 365 account so that works too.ConsScreen is not the best, but no worse than any screen on a $400-500 laptopGoogle maps is a little slow to load, I hear this may have to do with a few new things it no longer does in the backgroundGoogle docs is great for typing documents, but if you need excel forget it.Overall this laptop feels like one worth twice as much. In fact if they sold one with a better screen, even at a higher cost, I do not think I would consider buying any other laptop again. But it is still worth 5 stars due to the $250. price

Reviews.Title: I love my chrome book
Reviews.Author: Dylan
Reviews.Content: I love my chrome book because it is so powerful, but also so light and easy to carry. I am seven year's old and I think it is very cool. I got it on December 25, 2012.

Reviews.Title: Forgot how much I like a keyboard!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've got an iPad and a Nexus 7, but the only device I use anymore is the Samsung Chromebook! It is so portable, lightweight, and operates smoothly and is quite snappy as far as speed goes.  I thought I loved the whole tablet thing, but after having this for about five months now and using a real keyboard (which has a great feel to it), it's hard to go back to the virtual keyboards on the tablets. I was seriously considering the MacBook Air, but after using this, there's really nothing more I would want--it meets my needs just fine, especially for the price!  About the only thing that it lacks that I might like would be the capability to download movies for travelling---but it's no biggie....I just download a good book or two on my Kindle. This is just a great device for someone who primarily uses the internet, and I think most people do.  I have also found myself taking advantage of the cloud storage so now I can access all my photos and documents wherever I am on whatever device I choose! This Chromebook is truly a joy to use!

Reviews.Title: Best poor man's linux computer
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: I turned on developer mode with crouton and this is essentially a linux machine. Minimal installation, no hardware compatibility issues, great price point. You just can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: The Chromebook - A Student's Dream
Reviews.Author: Reece Franklin
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased my Chromebook for school- however, the day I ordered it, my main PC broke. My initial thoughts were something along the lines of "How am I going to survive with only the internet," and "How can I live without Skype?!?" I used Skype for daily communication, so when my PC broke, I was devastated. No matter what my initial thoughts were, I love this Chromebook. Whether using it to speed through essays with it's super-comfortable keyboard, or browsing the web at speeds faster than any of my computers prior, I do not regret my purchase in the least.Compatibility-  For those of you worried about losing your Microsoft Office, don't be. While it does not run it, the Chromebook comes packed with Google Drive, an office suite I find just as capable as MS Office. Everything is stored in the cloud (Which you get 100 gigabytes extra for free in, by the way) by Google, so I feel my data won't get blown away by server errors. For the gamers out there, this does not run ANY programs other than the web browser and its various extensions. However, you can still do a lot with it. (See Productivity)Productivity-  Is it possible to be productive on a Chromebook? In my experience, yes. As a matter of fact, I found myself more productive on a Chromebook, as I had less distractions in all. As I've said, Google Drive comes bundled, along with 100 GB free of cloud storage. It may be a bit more difficult to be productive offline, but this is solved with the 3G model. You are never offline. Verizon offers up 100 MB of free 3G- which is more than enough for me, considering I almost never leave my router.Form Factor-  The Chromebook is light, and slim too. As a student, the last thing I need are more things weighing down my bookbag- and with the Chromebook, I can drop it in my bookbag without worry. It is extremely easy to carry, and I absolutely love the keyboard. It is comfortable, sleek, and due to it's island-style, I make many less typos. Also- I get around 9-12 hours of battery life out of this thing with the brightness set low. That is AMAZING.Conclusion-  If you are a student that only needs the web, go for it. If you are an adult that mainly uses Facebook and checks your bank account- get it. The only demographic I wouldn't recommend it to would be gamers. For the rest of the population, there may be minor drawbacks, but since there is a suitable image editor on the Chromebook, nearly everyone should be fine.The battery life is phenomenal, so it's perfect for people who are always on the go. Overall, a great product.

Reviews.Title: Its The Best Technology I have Purchased Recently
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook is exactly what I wanted.  It is very light-weight. The instant on and off feature is a big plus.  Battery-life is also acceptable.  Battery-life is never as much as you would like but on the Chromebook its between 6 & 7 hours.  I am now learning the Chrome OS and I really like it.  Google Drive for storage seems to work well.  Finally, the remote desktop allowing me to access my Dell laptop is wonderful.  I can still access all my old files and can use my Office applications if I like.The Samsung Chromebook far exceeds all my expectations!

Reviews.Title: Elegantly simple
Reviews.Author: SouthernEagle
Reviews.Content: It's well documented that the Samsung Chromebook is NOT a powerful computing device.What it does, however, it does incredibly well. I use if for writing, surfing the web, email and occasionally watching online videos.For videos, the picture is fine but nothing special. The audio is very loud for a "laptop," but also hollow and a bit tinny -- so, also fine but nothing special.If you want a device for consumption of movies, TV shows and music, get an Android tablet or an iPad. If you want to edit video, photos or audio, get a computer.If you want a light, thin, affordable device with a great keyboard and a good battery for just about anything else, the Samsung Chromebook is perfect. I had to make one small modification, because there is a website admin page I use for work, which I occasionally need to use remotely, that requires Firefox Browser for whatever reason. I got directions from Google to side load the  Ubuntu OS, and I use Firefox from there. Every single other thing I use the Chromebook for works flawlessly in the Chrome browser.I describe it as "elegantly simple." Updates are automatic, and there really is no operating system to speak of.I purchased mine used for $177.94 on Amazon. It arrived in its original packaging, it came fast (Prime), and with a few very small cosmetic blemishes (as expected), but well worth it for the amazing price.My one and only (minor) complaint with the device is that the letters on the keyboard are lower case, which took some getting used to for me. But the keyboard really is the best I've ever typed on as far as speed and feel. The trackpad is great, although I'm told it's not up to par with the Macbook, which I've never used.If you're on the fence, buy it.EDIT:05/03/14 -- My Samsung Chromebook froze up on me and would only load a blank, white screen. I suspect it may have had something to so with the extra OS (Ubuntu) I installed on the machine, but I don't know. I'm adding this to my review to compliment Samsung's customer service. I called their customer service number, described the issue and everything I'd done to alter the hard drive and within seconds they emailed me a shipping label. I boxed it up and sent it in, and within a week I had it back in full working order. The entire process cost me nothing. The system was wiped, so when I powered it up it was the screen that pops up when first purchasing the device, but that's part of the beauty of a Chromebook. All I needed to do was log in, and the whole thing loaded up exactly as if nothing had happened (minus a few files I had stored on the hard drive, but that is to be expected after a hard reset.)I've owned a handful of Samsung devices in the past, but this was the first time I'd needed a repair. The experience was completely painless from start to finish, and much quicker than I could have expected.One other thing, I won't be re-installing Ubuntu. I've set the "Chrome Remote Desktop" application to mirror my PC, and it is a really, really seamless experience, so for the few times I need to use Firefox, I use that app in the Chrome OS. It will work with your PC's audio, too. The recently-released version of "Chrome Remote" for Android does not offer audio (from what I can tell, as of 05/03/14).

Reviews.Title: I love my Samsung Chromebook!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Queen
Reviews.Content: The Samsung chromebook is sleek and very efficient. I use it for college purposes, when I type my papers I will save it in Google docs and also email myself my document and later save it to my Word document. Many folks complain about how the chromebook not having a delete key and honestly, who cares, just push backspace if you need to fix something, in my opinion it works the same way. If you have an account with Google then it should be pretty simple to use everything that is offered by Google. It holds a battery for 6 hrs, and it charges super quick. This product is worth investing in. My husband couldn't understand why I had to have this chromebook but then I saw him a several times on my Samsung chromebook. And then he told me he likes my chromebook. Overall great product! I am happy with it. It is great for school!! Give it a chance, if you don't like then return.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Laptop!
Reviews.Author: J. Lonneville
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop for my wife who previously had shared a desktop with me although used her iPhone for the majority of her computing.This Chromebook works flawlessly.  She uses it for reading blogs, browsing the web (facebook, news...), and for streaming videos.  For all of those tasks, there is not a better computer.  The price is the icing on the cake.The keyboard shortcuts (and the easy tricks for remembering and finding them out) have increased her efficiency on a computer more than I could have imagines.I have a laptop, iPhone, and a beast of a desktop and have been tempted to buy another Chromebook for myself to have it around while I watch TV or for a light laptop for traveling or short trips.  It is truly a great laptop.

Reviews.Title: My new favorite toy
Reviews.Author: dsygonzlz
Reviews.Content: I loveee coming home to the lightest laptop ever. I love that it is simple and straight to the point. I can do what I have to do online, still keeps my documents and pictures stores, and I can just carry it anywhere. I love it. Perfect for the basic things and perfect for school once it begins.

Reviews.Title: Just what she needed.
Reviews.Author: E. WEBB
Reviews.Content: This is perfect for the wife to get online and watch Netflix, YouTube, Lifetime movies and the like.. Being light weight and portable is definitely a plus.. Getting about 7 hrs battery life, which is VERY good compared to our other laptops.. I did change the search key back to a CAPS LOCK key because we don't use a search key.. The speakers could definitely stand to be a bit louder, but I won't deduct a star for that since she already has some small folding stereo speakers that she uses anyway..Apple iPod Shuffle 2G Black Portable Folding Stereo Mini Speaker [Electronics]We decided to get this IPearl plastic cover for it to keep it from getting scratches  since so many people said the Chromebook scratches easily..iPearl mCover Hard Shell Case for 11.6" Samsung Chromebook (Wi-Fi or 3G) laptop - PinkAll in all we're very happy with the Chromebook.. We've run into no problems with it, and we would definitely buy it again..

Reviews.Title: Good cheap travel notebook (well, Chromebook).
Reviews.Author: Linh Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Update: after using this Chromebook for a couple of weeks. I've learned a few new things.a) There are tons of hidden/experimental features for you to play around with. Just enter about:flags in the browser. Be careful though.b) You can install a basic Ubuntu interface and hot-swap between the two OSes, but I find myself using the Chrome OS all the time.c) It's really nicely built. I really like the design of this cheapo Chromebook.d) Google updated their Chrome apps for offline usage!******************************************Let's keep this simple.Pros:- Very cheap. I bought a used/very good one directly from Amazon Warehouse for $145+tax. That's at least 50% cheaper than the cheapest 10" tablet.- Nice looking laptop. Very clean design with round edges.- Light as well. I can see myself carrying this around with one hand easily.- Decent-sized and responsive keypad. This is easily a deal-maker.- Nice and big trackpad. Supports multi-touch.- Chrome Web Store has plenty of apps to do whatever you want.Cons: (let's keep in mind that this is a $150-200 notebook)- Screen lacks contrast, saturation and has a rather narrow viewing angle.- Trackpad is just nice, not great. Limited multi-touch gestures.- A little slow. Maybe it's ChromeOS, maybe it's the hardware. But doesn't run as smooth as I'd like it to.- Just web apps. But hey, it's a Chromebook. I just wish the button in taskbar didn't say "apps" when they're really just links to websites.Overall, I feel that this is a great product from Samsung. And assuming you'll always have internet whenever you use it, this will be a great traveling companion.

Reviews.Title: Great chromebook! beta instructions!
Reviews.Author: VS2929
Reviews.Content: I got this chromebook in new condition(not damaged at all), it works great! It may be very limited but for an intern or student this laptop is incredible! I joined chrome beta so I can get the newest features first and the best part its free to join! Just open up chrome, click the menu button in the right corner, go to settings, help, then switch to beta and an update should waiting for you!I do recommend it if your a student or intern or someone who needs to take notes. By the way: If you buy this chromebook, Google will give you 100gb's of drive storage for 2 years so if you add 100+the 15gb's you already have it totals to 115gb's for 2 years!***Update 1/4/2014***: This Chromebook still runs 100% fine and with Beta is still great! Remember people: Beta will give you all the latest features before the general public so you get a nice Treat!

Reviews.Title: Useful, but not a laptop replacement
Reviews.Author: L. Bravim
Reviews.Content: Do not mistake the Samsung Chromebook for a laptop. That it is not. This is a nifty little device that can easily fill the space of a tablet, netbook, or PDA. I do not like virtual keyboards and thus all the major tablets have a strike against them. This Chromebook has the portability of a tablet (it is very light) while keeping the most modern functions of a PC. The boot up time is super fast (way less than the 10 sec. advertised). The internet, with a chrome browser, chugs along very nicely on all the WiFi networks I have tried as well as the Verizon 3G. This machine is great for email, news, typing, video, and work.There are some shortcomings. Because it is powered by Google's OS, it is damn near impossible to download Skype. Those of us living and working in different parts of the world will sorely miss this program. Google Voice is the suggested alternative, but it is nowhere near as complete or universal as Skype. Another shortcoming is the requirement of a password for logon. I tried and tried, but the only way I've found to avoid this is by logging on as a guest. There may be a way, but it is nowhere near as obvious as with my Toshiba laptop.Aside from Google OS limitations, I have been quite happy with the hardware and performance of the internet on the Chromebook. Some have characterized it as a web browser with an 11-inch screen. That may be, but this is one fine browser.

Reviews.Title: perfect lightweight internet for my wife
Reviews.Author: Mr. Rick
Reviews.Content: This little thing has great battery life. We had a problem getting it to play video on the TV. Playback is choppy and stops frequently like it's buffering. We don't have this problem on an older Dell laptop so I doubt it's a bandwidth issue. Maybe we're overdriving the video chip on this thing; i don't know. For what it is and what it cost, it's just perfect! My wife tells me almost daily how happy she is that I got this for her.

Reviews.Title: light weight, decent performance, long battey-life
Reviews.Author: KOSIT SUKSINGHA
Reviews.Content: Just managed to get one and used it outside the US, the machine lives upto the expectation with good battery life (avg 5 hours) and its light weight.  Though I did find 3G setup to be a bit tricky and after I could get it up and running, switching from hybernation to active mode takes quite a bit of a time...final verdict--good product for daily usage!

Reviews.Title: First time user
Reviews.Author: Llymlaen "Don't need a watch to waste your time"
Reviews.Content: This the first time I use a Chromebook and I have to say that I really love it ! No more dealing with Windows and all their security issues when I just want to boot and be able to quickly get online to get the information I'm looking for. It's really light, doesn't overheat and pretty quiet; definitely making it my primary PC.

Reviews.Title: Very cool, thin, and fast
Reviews.Author: GH "The Watch Man"
Reviews.Content: The only negative point about this product is that has only 16GB storage.  Otherwise it is beautiful, sleekand on the cloud., fast and great for doing your work on the intent and in the cloud.  I bought it for my teenage daughter and she absolutely loves it!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Kris Bragg
Reviews.Content: The chrome notebook was exactly what I wanted.  Something small with all everything I needed personally. I really love it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Cheap - lightweight - decent number of apps available - Netflix works - Amazon Cloud Player works - runs cool and quiet - reasonable replacement for netbook, tablet, laptop for many functions.  It's kind of like a tablet with a keyboard.  Good screen and speakers.  Starts up virtually instantly, gotta love that.Cons:  Fewer apps than Windows and Android.  (Can't speak about Apple OS.)  Biggest concern for me would be build quality.  Screen bezel is not well secured on the sides.  SD card will not sit flush in it slot which makes it uncomfortable if you have the card installed whilst using device on your lap.  Power connector is quite small and looks fragile.Conclusion:  This device works well as advertised.  I would expect more apps to be available if Google Chrome takes off as an OS.  I also expect there will be a range of such devices in the future that will be both of better and lesser quality (well, couldn't be much less in build quality) in the future and of course prices will be under pressure then.

Reviews.Title: A fantastic budget laptop.
Reviews.Author: Nelbroth
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung Chromebook because it was cheaper than repairing my busted Windows laptop. After a few months of consistent use, I'm happy to report that I made the right choice. For $250, it serves its purpose well. This is a Google Chrome browser-based laptop -- that's it. The 11-inch screen is acceptable, the battery life is formidable, and the keyboard is surprisingly great. If you just need a light and quiet web browsing laptop and can live without the typical Windows programs (Google Drive does have stripped down versions of these programs that work fairly well, btw), you may want to consider this product, especially if you're strapped for cash. Would I buy a Chromebook if I had to do it over again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: In Love
Reviews.Author: Cryptic Red
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this laptop. It's tiny & light like the macbook air (though not quite as thin). It's easy to use. It's cheap. It seems quality-made. It starts super-fast. I can run multiple Google accounts easily. Offline work has been going pretty well too. It's exactly what we were looking for in a 2nd laptop for the home. I think the key is--you have to go into this purchase knowing what you're getting and what this is good for. It doesn't have all your Microsoft office apps, nor does it have a lot of storage space on the machine itself (it's all cloud). We still have a Macbook Air for our main computer that we use for images, music, etc. Occasionally, when I've needed to work in Microsoft Excel--it wasn't showing up right on this machine, and I had to use our main laptop. But if you want a nice laptop as a second one in the home --to be able to surf the web on or do some basic writing, editing, etc --and not spend too much? This is perfect.

Reviews.Title: This thing rocks!
Reviews.Author: Kitti
Reviews.Content: I can do all I need to do online, and with google docs. I love the 100GB of google drive, and with the GoGo Inflight Internet sessions, the hardware is nearly a freebie! Great for travelers, or lazy folks like me who just want a super-lightweight machine with just enough capabilities. Not a high-powered machine by any stretch, but for surfing, research, email, and some work online--it is the most inexpensive, workable option.

Reviews.Title: Google Laptop
Reviews.Author: Teresa Larson
Reviews.Content: I really like this It's just the right size to take along on vacation or to use in the kitchen. I like it better than the IPAD because you can use a mouse if you want to. The battery seems to stay charged for a long time....over all I am very happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: JGLLO
Reviews.Content: I like the Samsung Chromebook.Pros:Very lightInexpensiveVery quietNice keyboard layoutGood screenPlays videos wellBoots up and wakens from sleep very fastCons:Keyboard letters are lower case and harder to see than capsNo VNC Viewer for ARM processors - yetNo Delete keyExcept for the VNC capability, this replaces my stolen Acer Aspire One netbook nicely.Update:After several weeks, I still would recommend the ChromebookDelete key = Alt-BackspaceHave to look for an iTunes alternativeChrome Remote Desktop is a good alternative to VNC if you can install Chrome on the remote computer

Reviews.Title: Cloudy Happy Days
Reviews.Author: Neilah Desiree
Reviews.Content: I am in the cloud now.  Almost completely.  Needs to be plugged in when lighting is low.  Gets stuck when I don't know what I am doing, occasionally, but just turn it off, back on and 'Voila', a few seconds interruption instead of fifteen minutes.  The first time I got an update, I held my breath and I kid you not, by the time I had to breath again, the update was finished.  I am still getting used to Google+, Gmail and google docs, but most of the time it has simpler ways to do things and I am so used to the old fashioned way that I am making it harder.  I have found more than one choice(s) for every app I needed and I am avoiding apps that download to the machine (as much as possible).  I limited myself to one game, for example, lol.  It is heavier than I thought it would be, but lots lighter than my HP notebook/Apple Macbook.  I am going to get rid of both of them as soon as I convert my databases.  I was going to share it with my family, but not now.  Just like the commercial, I'm gonna be most attached.  Booting up takes seconds and shutdown about the same.  Battery power is good.  I did get a Targis Coolpad (out of closet) to keep the heat off my lap.  It is much cooler than other devices, but still after 2 hours, it gets warm.  I also bought a Merkury PINK and PURPLE cover sack with pockets so I can keep my headphones, flash drive and microphone handy.  Also, I use the headset to listen most of the time, because the speakers are on the bottom of the device.  I thought that was dumb, but my friend pointed out that if you put it on a hard surface, like a table, it vibrates against the table and sounds much better.  Who knew? Ahh, I'd prefer the USB connect on side or front, but not really that much trouble.  Does tend to stick out and makes it awkward on my lap-desk.  Overall, I have recommended to my friends, but there are lots of choices and migrating your stuff and some programs are not quite ready for cloudy days ahead, lol.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: Richard Schnatterly
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant to purchase a "glorified web browser" but in all honesty, this Samsung Chromebook has far exceeded my expectations.  There is virtually no lag whatsoever when I open it from "sleep".  The trackpad is quite sensitive and feels well built.  When I ordered the Chromebook, I was intending on purchasing a small wired or wireless mouse to go with it as I've never really been a fan of trackpads.  This changed with the Chromebook.  With very minimal effort, I am able to browse various websites, save pictures and files quite easily, and scroll up and down lengthy webpages.  I transferred several mp4 movies to a SD card and they play without flaw on this device.  This very affordable Samsung laptop provides me with an excellent tool for accomplishing 99% of what I need a laptop for.  I've used it for several weeks now and have never experienced a "lock-up" requiring a reboot, nor have I experienced any sluggishness.  Extremely pleased with this purchase.  Well done Samsung for a well designed device and Google for the insight in creating this concept!_Update 8-9-2013Had an incident the other day which gave me reason to be concerned.  I charged the Chromebook overnight and took it to work.  When I first used it, no problem.  Put it in "sleep" mode and went back to work.When I opened it up an hour later, the device was shut off completely.  Would not come on at all despite all resetting efforts.Took it home and plugged it in and viola!  Came on immediately.  Showed that it still had 94% charge remaining.  I have no idea why it would not come on at work but when plugged in at home it came right on.I still love my Chromebook, just do some research online (owners forums) first, and make an informed purchasing decision.  Would I buy another Chromebook after experiencing this one-time incident?  Yes, but I would probably wait for at least a year to make sure that Samsung (or Google) has worked out any "bugs" in the hardware/software.

Reviews.Title: My mom loves it.
Reviews.Author: Dele
Reviews.Content: I got this computer for my mom because I could not stand all the viruses and problems that normal laptops have. She learned how to use the computer really fast and stopped calling me every other day about something not working.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook
Reviews.Author: FREDERICK ZAWACKI
Reviews.Content: I'm having a great time with this laptop.  For an old guy  (70), I'm moving around the web with ease and speed.  Not worrying about screwing things up.  Thanks Tons!

Reviews.Title: The computer of the future (and today)
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: This is a very refined and easy to use computer. The keyboard is as large as my 17" laptop's, minus the number pad. Hardware is great, especially how it is fanless, but a little weak maybe for an intensive web game. The screen feels larger than I would have expected.But let me get to the chase. The OS is awesome for everything web. Since I use a lot of web services, I can use my Chromebook a lot, and its a very refined experience. If the Chromebook can do it, I'll use it over my larger Windows 8 machine, because it just works so well. Its snappy; it really does boot in under 10 seconds, every time. And I never have to wait for a bogged down system. When its booted, it is fully up and running, unlike a Windows machine where it boots and then you still have to wait 30 seconds before you can actually do anything.I would absolutely recommend this if you understand its limitations and are Ok with them. But also know that if you can't live without your Windows programs, this also makes a fairly cheap secondary computer.

Reviews.Title: So far, this is just what I need
Reviews.Author: Angela M. Hiteshew
Reviews.Content: I am no longer a student, I am no longer a blogger, so I don't have much need of doing anything that requires a lot of computer memory. I don't need powerpoint or photoshop on a personal computer anymore. On my HP laptop, I can't think of the last time I used any program (other than the web or my windows media player), and I hate always clicking "no" for the almost-constant automatic updates for all sorts of things. I bought my HP laptop in my last year at college (three years ago now), and we all know that laptops aren't built to last a lifetime. The only thing I really love about it is Windows 7, and I refused to buy a Windows 8 laptop. With that being said, I've been in the market for a new laptop for the past few months. But like I said, I don't need much of anything on a laptop these days. I had thought about getting an Acer Aspire S3 after seeing it at an electronics store, but then it sold out, and the S5 and S7 were much more (expensive) than I needed.Then I heard (or stumbled upon an article that reminded me) of Chromebooks. And at $250, it sounded perfect for me.A little about me: I bought a 1st-gen Kindle Fire last spring, and I love that for reading and light web-browsing on the go. Then last summer I got a Samsung Galaxy S3, and that basically took over for my Kindle, except for being able to read books (I probably should have just gone with a cheaper kindle then...). But neither the Kindle Fire nor the S3 give me good web browsing abilities.So far, this Chromebook fits my needs very well. It's small, it's light, it has surprisingly nice speakers, and WOW, it's so QUIET!! I'm also surprised at how FAST it boots up. Even from being completely powered off. And how fast it shuts down! Really nice. No more waiting for programs to load in the background!!I've never used a Chiclet keyboard before, so this is my first time using one (and it's a little difficult. Most keyboards I use are more cramped than this. For example, I think the "backspace" key is kind of far away, so I keep hitting the equals sign accidentally). The trackpad could be better. I honestly like the one on my HP better than this. It's just taking a little more getting used to, I guess. I think the screen is pretty good. I don't have any bad thoughts about it just yet.I'll try to update this review in a few days, but so far, so good. I've only had it about two hours so far!EDIT: Second day: After listening to Pandora pretty loud for a little bit, I've noticed the speakers can be "tinny," if you understand what I mean. It's only apparent if the volume is really loud, most likely little vibrations against the body of the computer. A little annoying, but not awful...

Reviews.Title: finally a device for non-savy users but good for all
Reviews.Author: J. Biedel
Reviews.Content: read other reviews with interest and decided to check one out in the flesh. For my 93 old Mother who checks email and logs into her various accounts, this paired with Lastpass is ideal. Highly recommended for ease of use and value.

Reviews.Title: Too cool!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really like this.  It isn't a "full computer" but for web browsing & basic at home use, it is amazing. The battery lasts forever & it even fits in my purse.

Reviews.Title: good for light, casual use
Reviews.Author: Shorrie H.
Reviews.Content: I use this when my wife is hogging the laptop.  The surfing is extremely fast and the mouse pad thingy is very nice how they integrate the 2 buttons into the touch sensor.  One of my main complaints is it doesn't seem to stream youtube songs on one tab while you surf on another tab.  The songs will skip if you aren't on the youtube tab.  Might not be a problem for anyone else though.

Reviews.Title: Research this product before you purchase it.
Reviews.Author: Peter Franaszek
Reviews.Content: I am currently an engineering student. I was primarily worried that I wouldn't be able to find an IDE that would support python, or C++, or some other random programming language. At the moment it would be nice if MATLAB made an effort to make an extension for chrome (seeing as there is one for the ipad/phone already), but that's not really a necessity.I purchased this product because there are times when I just need to do homework, work on papers, read textbooks (pdf formatted), and I was tired of lugging around my old macbook (which has horrible battery life). The battery life on this particular Chromebook is obscene. On day 2, I had it running continuously for 7 straight hours, switching between random web-surfing for breaks and working on a lab report/reading a text. Lets get one thing absolutely clear if you're planning on purchasing this device: it is not a powerful piece of equipment, so don't expect to edit video, or mix your own music or whatever.Anyway, this thing is perfect if you travel often, need to work on things that are easily saved to the cloud, The speakers aren't very good, but the headphone jack is there if you're listening to music. The screen is pretty good and adjusts depending on the ambient light levels, which is more useful than I thought. Netflix and Amazon Prime stream nicely, as does Youtube. I've noticed that the streaming video really is dependent on your internet speed (I frequently go to a family member's house that only has about 2 Mbps, and the video may have to re-buffer every now and then, but at my home with 15 Mbps, it's seamless, you can test your own internet speed at speedtest.net.So, with that rambling over, here's a list of stuff:PROS:LightweightPortableKeyboard is great (web enabled)Screen adjusts to ambient lightVideo streams wellScreen has pretty decent resolutionBattery life is CRAZY (you're looking at between 6-8 hours with a full charge)FREE 100 Gb on Google drive is pretty nice ($60 saved), can be accessed everywhereThere's also plenty of free 5Gb cloud servers out there if you look (amazon, ubuntu, etc)Trackpad is very intuitiveCONS:Speakers are badUnable to install certain software, but you should know that already

Reviews.Title: Life-saver
Reviews.Author: J. D. Ngo "mind-expanding book lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a backup computer since my much-loved Macbook has been on the fritz and acting funny after 4 years of use.  As a grad student, I use my laptop constantly for writing papers and doing research, so I really needed a reliable computer.  I also do not have $1,500 to shell out on a new Macbook at the last minute.  After checking out other cheap laptops (including touchscreens with Windows 8), as well as notebooks and this computer, I couldn't deny the fact that the Samsung Chromebook got consistently good reviews while laptops more than twice its price were getting pretty crappy reviews.  Since I couldn't really afford anything, I got the Chromebook on a whim about a week ago.  Tonight I was forced to learn how to use it quickly after my Macbook died and I lost the paper I was working on.  I found an emailed version, uploaded it into Google Docs, hooked up the Chromebook to my WiFi printer (Epson Workforce 645), and I am very pleased.  The brightness and quality of display, as well as the included apps had me pleasantly delighted.  The Chrome store is also pretty fun to look through, and has many apps that I already use on my Macbook (incl. Dropbox, which has all my school docs).  It plays video well so far, and apparently is also capable of sharing remote desktop to another computer, and uploading iTunes libraries into its native music player.  It also does look like a cute little Mac Air (clean lines, though extremely cheap).  I was hesitant about whether I would catch on to using this, but I'm starting to really like it so far.  I was very wary of whether this could really allow me to type papers and print, but so far everything works.  Let's see how it holds up to heavier use.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS!!
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Benitez
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I bought this. The price is AMAZING and the computer itself even better!! I would've paid three times this amount for it. A lot of rumors going around on these reviews and reviews around the web, do your own research and take the risk! you WON'T regret it! It can do so much more than people make it sound. Now if your not a chrome fan you shouldn't even been looking at this, but it is PERFECT. SO happy I didn't spend over a grand on a Macbook AIR.

Reviews.Title: Love my Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Hall
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest mini laptop ever. It does it all and is cute to boot! Love it and would recommend it to anyone looking for an easy to use, carry and store laptop.

Reviews.Title: small, light, functional
Reviews.Author: Stanley P. Miller
Reviews.Content: Meets our web surfing needs as well as a Windows or a Mac laptop for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Ana Bananas "A woman who is always on the go,...
Reviews.Content: Okay yeah I love this thing! If you are looking something to hold your music, surf the web, check out email, & fool around with photos and stuff. This is your thing! Without spending a fortune on a big time laptop. PLEASE NOTE: If you are looking to do some serious stuff on here and would need to do things off line then this not it. Google does offer somethings off line but I'm still working out how to use that. If you have some basic knowledge or really no knowledge of lap top/net books/notebooks tablets...blah blah blah, you will be just fine with this. I had a Kindle Fire before this and wanted to up grade (love my Fire but didn't want to spend $$$ for a new HD one) and HATE trying to type without a keyboard. I do pretty much everything with this Chromebook. I email, Facebook, Skype (has a built in camera), after some trial and error I figured out how to download music and transferred music from versus places. You Tube ...Crackle....a ton of apps....hmmm there is just some much with this thing and it is just so easy to use. I bought one for myself and one for the Hubby at 250 bucks a pop - though not pocket change - Chromebook is TOTALLY WORTH IT!  ****Now I have heard not so great things about the Acer Chromebook so I again recommend the Samsung****  PSSS - sorry forgot, wait to get any of the Chromebook for Dummies like books because I myself got one (@ 26 bucks) and I looked at it once! The manual that comes with the Chromebook is pretty straight forward and has plenty of info & of course if you feel like you need more then go for it, I just wish I kept my 26 bucks in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Fun toy
Reviews.Author: Philip J. Warburton
Reviews.Content: I really liked it until the screen cracked seemingly on its own, less than a month after I got it. Apparently, this is a common issue, which I found out when searching for a screen replacement.  I was carrying it in a bag with three other laptops and a 10" tablet, and they are all fine, so I really have no idea how it could have happened. I got a replacement. I had noticed that the keys were leaving imprints on the screen, so I purchased some rubber feet and put them on the new laptop at the top of the screen bezel, hopefully this will prevent future problems. If I don't edit this review, it means the screen hasn't broken again...Aside from that, it's a very interesting machine. The performance is very good, especially with a single browser window it seems much more responsive than regular laptops of comparable price. The picture quality of the screen is good, the keyboard is comfortable, and it's very quiet due to the lack of a fan. I bought it more for purposes of having an ARM machine to play with, and as far as that goes it's probably the best option - it's very accommodating to developers.

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: Thinh
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm using the chromebook to type this review. I am sure that there are both good and bad reviews for the Samsung Chromebook. I personally read the other reviews before making this purchase. I find that the negative reviews were for those who do not understand the purpose of this innovating device. Wouldn't everybody use the internet if they had access to a laptop or similar device? I do not play games or do much of anything offline anymore when I'm using a laptop. That is what I do on my desktop. The system does have its limits, but it is perfectly capable of accessing popular websites.Most of the good reviews on this device are true. I love the keyboard, battery life, screen size, and speed compared to an expensive laptop. I have a small budget, so I was thinking about purchasing either a small tablet with a Bluetooth or Wi-Fi keyboard or a device like this. I made the right choice with this purchase because the screen size is big and the system is easy to use compared to a tablet with a separate keyboard of similar price. Plus, I do not want to hassle with putting on a screen protector for a tablet. I will definitely buy another product like this, and hopefully technology will just keep on improving for such wonders!

Reviews.Title: My new baby!
Reviews.Author: Deborah Childress
Reviews.Content: Love love love this little Chromebook.  It does everything I need and I dont have to mess with all the anti-virus nonsense thats always popping up on other computers.  Just open it up and im off to the races!

Reviews.Title: Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect Xmas gift for my son who broke his 1 year old laptop accidentally a few months prior.  It was cheaper than his original laptop and is enough for him to do his schoolwork since most of their work is done online via google docs.

Reviews.Title: Handy little machine
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This computer is absolutely perfect for web-related stuff. It's NOT a game machine. It's a little workhorse that helps you get stuff done without the distractions. Great for writers who just want to be able to access their documents, emails, and research on the web.  I haven't had a problem with Netflix or Hulu. YouTube runs smoothly. The sound is impressive for such a small machine.  Spotify's beta web player also works really well.  You can't bog it down with a lot of games and programs.It is NOT, however, for someone who has to have Microsoft Office installed. It's also not what you're looking for if you want to get a fairly inexpensive machine for kids -- unless you want them to focus on their homework instead of gaming.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase and best price for such a useful tool
Reviews.Author: Angela B Callahan
Reviews.Content: I've been researching what to buy after my current laptop (7yrs old) needs replacing. I was completely confused and overwhelmed by the choices. I saw a banner ad on Google's website and thought I should investigate. I was glad I did since I hadn't heard of Chromebooks before. There were 3 or 4 brands with varying prices on the resulting page I was sent to and after researching the features, prices, processors, etc. I decided on the Samsung Chromebook with Wi-Fi. My main reason was the Samsung processor had excellent reviews for speed and reliability. I also like Samsung's reputation in the electronics arena.I opted not to get the 3G feature, which is upgradeable as there is a SIM card slot. The 100GB of cloud storage on the Google server is another great bonus. Since I don't do gaming and I don't save music to my phone or computers, I'll have a hard time using it all in that timeframe.The computer boots up in a matter of seconds, is quiet (SS hard drive), has a battery that really does last for several hours, the display is crystal clear, and the sound is great. As I mentioned, I don't do gaming and have read that this Chromebook is probably not for that use. There are plenty of other options in that regard.I have my Android phone, my laptop and my Chromebook all using Google Chrome and all are synched, making life using multiple gadgets much simpler. I'm extremely pleased with this Chromebook and feel like I should have bought another one to save for the future!

Reviews.Title: Does what I need it to.
Reviews.Author: Jillian
Reviews.Content: Its very light and easy to store. I bought this for school so I wouldn't have to lug around my bigger laptop and it is great. It does exactly what I need it to do.
