Reviews.Content: I did my research and had my expectations set high for this laptop and i was not disappointed. It's got everything i need in a computer and besides an occasional iffy wi-fi connection i've got nothing but compliments. Well done google.

Reviews.Title: Made me a believer in the cloud
Reviews.Author: Yoshi
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great, especially if you are a heavy user in all things Google. It really forces you to live in the "cloud", and once you do you don't want to go back. I now have all my documents, pictures, and music in the included 100 GB of cloud storage and I love it. Everything syncs on all my devices automatically. I don't have to think about what pictures are on each device or having to upload new music to my phone, my tablet, my computers, all separately. Plus you don't have to worry about losing everything to fire or theft. If you get another Chromebook everything is already setup.As for the laptop itself, it's become the device I use the most. The screen won't impress anyone or the plastic body, but it's got a great keyboard, battery life and about as light as my iPad. I actually see this more as a tablet replacement than a desktop one. There are some downside: it's not terribly fast which can be noticeable, of course you're limited to what you can do through a web browser and you mostly need to be online, and for some reason locally saved videos tend to stutter but play fine online. But at this price I have no problem recommending it to anyone especially people who have found their tablets to be very limiting.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: i like it i didnt know when i bought it was a wireless only computer but other then that i like it very much

Reviews.Title: samsung Chromebook
Reviews.Author: kenny
Reviews.Content: Wife love it can get her off from the ChromeBook very light and handy easy for travel we are planning to use it went we travel

Reviews.Title: what a great computer!
Reviews.Author: in virginia
Reviews.Content: I am tech-challenged, and so I took the advice of a savvy friend to buy the Samsung Chromebook.I don't do any games or fancy stuff...mostly email, some surfing, and I need basic word processing for some writing I do.  This little machine is perfect. And little it is! so convenient to travel; but once I open it up, it seems plenty roomy.I was a little concerned about the cloud-based system, but so far no problems.  Also, it's easy to compose and edit documents off-line, so I don't have to be in range of a wi-fi source.Nice clear display.  Easy to learn functions.  What's not to like?And at $249, what a great price!

Reviews.Title: Loving it
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: There is still a ways to go on development, but works as intended as a cloud device, as it develops into a more complex operating system, we will see more features that are seen on any mainstream OS that we are all accustomed too. Chrome OS and this laptop are simply one step ahead of the future (cloud computing).

Reviews.Title: My new favorite computer
Reviews.Author: June Harris
Reviews.Content: I've been looking at websites since November trying to find this in stock. I ordered it as soon as I saw it was back in stock at normal price on Amazon. Almost everything I do is connected in some way to the Google cloud. We use Google Apps at my church (I'm the Online Pastor). I already have a Galaxy tab 10.1, which I love, but also wanted a laptop that was light-weight, very portable, but had a physical keyboard/mousepad for some of my tasks. I have a full-size laptop, but that gets heavy carrying places. I just opened my new Chromebook today, and was instantly connected to all my websites and tools. I've had it on most of the day (over 6 hours) and have watched hulu plus for an hour & a half, and there is still 24% battery left. Amazing! If you mainly use a computer for web browsing, I definitely recommend the Samsung Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: It's not perfection but it may fit your needs perfectly
Reviews.Author: Silent Jay "Amazon-holic"
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short as there are already 800 reviews.Pros:Great for web browsingextremely extremely portablerenders google maps wellgreat battery lifesuper light weightgreat typing pad (as good as macbook air, if not better IMO)good HDMI output to hdtvCons:underpowered.  if you can wait 6-8 months, I assume google will come out with something more powerful.  i couldn't wait.  The power is just about adequate but any bit less would be too little for me.viewing angle sucks, but if its just you looking no problem!Trackpad sucks.  scrolling with it is sluggish so i must use a usb mousevideo playing will slow down other tabs a lot.  so if you plan on watching videos, don't expect to be able to multitask.intensive websites like facebook take noticeable longer to render.

Reviews.Title: A nice piece of kit for $249
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: It's exactly a netbook, but with a proprietary Google OS. However, it's very light, and the 6.5 hours of battery life is very easy to attain. 2/3 screen brightness and average web browsing will easily get you there (this does not include youtube videos or flash games, which eat battery for breakfast lunch and dinner). If you're very careful, offline, etc, you should hit 9 hours or a bit more. But, really, who types for 9 hours?If you're looking for a desktop replacement, this IS NOT it. If you're looking for a secondary computer for general web use while out and about, this beats the ipad (and tables in general) hands down (in my opinion) because it's much, much more capable. An iPad with a keyboard (my last mobile solution, and it was a nice keyboard) was no match for this Chromebook.Looking for a downside? The screen, while nice enough, uses a very matte surface to reduce glare, which causes it to look a bit dull, and slightly dirty. Otherwise, the obvious downside of it being essentially a browser is apparent. However, for typing, Google Docs now works offline (obviously syncing when you're back online).Overall, I love this device, and at $249, it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Good Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Scott Eberlein
Reviews.Content: Overall I am really happy with this purchase.  The price is great, and the dual core A15 processor provides performance and battery life.  The keyboard is great, the mouse pad is great, the screen is more than sufficient for daily use (brightness and resolution).  My only disappointment here is that the video card cannot send an analog signal through the HDMI port, this would be helpful for projection, as many projectors in use still have only a VGA input, and is a feature that some tablets, and ultrabooks have - not a huge deal, I would have preferred to know this before trying to run it through the same HDMI to VGA cord that works with my other devices.Again, this is a great product. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, great for students!
Reviews.Author: Lynne
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this laptop for school and I love it. It's fast and lightweight, it comes with basically everything that a student would need. I'm normally an Apple person but I have to say I'm really impressed with this laptop. My only cons are the laptop NEEDS wifi to work to it's full capacity and you cannot save your documents to the "desktop".Also, it doesn't allow me to sync my iPhone to the laptop, at all and Netflix does not work.But aside from those small cons, the laptop is great and such a good price.I would recommend this to any student who needs something to use for school.Great apps - mySchoolNotebook, 90's games, Zoho documents and slide rocket from the google chrome store.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Gregory L. Head
Reviews.Content: Great machine.  Easy to use. Lite weight, Great Video Display,It's slow and skips when you try to watch streamed media like a news channel.  Could use more RAM.

Reviews.Title: Super Cheap - Super easy
Reviews.Author: Sathish
Reviews.Content: This chromebook is what is needed for a user who is using Google apps - Docs, picasaweb, slides, sheets etc. Very easy to set up accounts. Authenticates using Google accounts. You can add as many users as you want - each gets their unique space. It is just a browser but most of the work these days are done on a browser. Hangouts - Camera gives very clear image. More useful if using google phone number as we can answer calls within the system. As a user of all these features (have been using GrandCentral phone number before Google bought it), this book compliments my work and hobbies.

Reviews.Title: Great product for price...
Reviews.Author: Ed VanderWindt
Reviews.Content: I got this computer last week, and although I haven't had it for long, I already love it. I bought this product from amazon even though they said out of stock, but too days later, I got an email saying that it was shipped, and a couple days after that it was on my doorstep. I'm very impressed with the design, and it is quicker then I expected. I was also thrilled when I plugged in my old DELL mouse, and it hooked up right away. I would recommend this to anyone who like to travel, or is just looking for a alternative to windows. I love how it is absolutely quiet, and their is very little heat. I cannot express how thin it is, a friend of mine saw it, and almost didn't believe the price, and he used it for a awhile, and was very impressed. It's faster then my dual core 4gb ram windows laptop. The sound is also way better then I thought. I would encourage anyone looking for a cheap laptop to buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Love my Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: W. C. Kerr
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old Toshiba laptop died recently. The hard drive crashed, it was in need of a new battery and fan (both for the third time) and the screen hinge had broken. I was not interested in either a Windows machine or a Mac. I bought a Samsung Chromebook and I'm very happy I did. I had already moved most of my music and documents to the cloud so the change was easy. In two weeks with the Chromebook I haven't missed the local apps that used to clutter up my machines (word processing, video editing, anti-virus, etc.). I open the screen on this thing and in a few seconds I'm on the web for email, Google apps (calendar, documents), games, Facebook, you name it. I have enough local storage on it to save various things but I haven't found the need to. I get about 6 hours of battery life, it runs cool all day, connects to all WiFi networks without incident. and the keyboard is a pleasure. Around two pounds to carry, it slips into my work bag and I hardly know it's there. The other day it did a system update in about 10 seconds. The fact that it is always up to date and virus free only adds to the advantages. Thanks Google and Samsung! As far as I'm concerned, you hit it out of the park!

Reviews.Title: Internet Machine Value
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This product is superb for a user that does not need desktop applications.  Folks invested into the Google ecosystem will find it quite natural.  The operating system (Chrome) is very light weight and out of the user's way.  The keyboard is comfortable and functional.  Battery life has satisfied (~6.5hrs actual use).  Multiple account support is very clean and easy.The screen is a matte finish and you will definitely notice it's quality isn't the highest (although to be fair I am comparing this to my desktop's ultra sharp).Recommended overall.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Keith R. Lancaster "mugglekeith"
Reviews.Content: After a slight learning curve for "cloud" based data and program access, my father found the Chromebook to be a great fit. Quick power up. Quality keyboard. Responsive processor.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Delia P. Angel
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 12 year old granddaughter for Christmas and she loves it. It is a perfect size for her and it is fast and lightweight. She is very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: JJohnson
Reviews.Content: I love my new chromebook. It's the perfect size for school and work. I had already been starting to use a lot of the Google apps for work and personal. I love being able to quickly switch between accounts. Quick at restart. And it's so fast! I love that it will never get slow. (I've even heard Apple people say that they like the chromebook.)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic secondary device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very easy to use, great solid keyboard, a few keys missing compared to a full keyboard but combo-keys easily fix that (example, no delete key, but alt-backspace works as delete), can do all my non-business day-to-day things on my chromebook.  I easily sync using GoogleDrive, Dropbox, SkyDrive and Evernote, so I have just about immediate access to all the files I need anytime as long as I'm connected to a network.  Ability to put into full-screen mode using [shift + screen] buttons to maximize viewing space and that works pretty well.  No moving parts so it should be more durable and battery lasts longer - I think this laptop is better than the cheaper Acer chromebook, which has a spinning hard disk.  Battery life is fantastic, it's lightweight, doesn't get hot, and I can use the small solid state hard drive to download/upload files between my accounts.Cons: Audio is poor, viewing the screen from an angle (from sides or above/below) is not great, and the hinge in the back prevents the screen from tilting back more than 45% (which is only an issue because of the usable viewing screen angle).  Can't print using USB connections, instead have to use network printer (not an issue for me, but might be for some). Can't replace my business laptop because Microsoft Office applications (powerpoint and excel for me) have no good online equivalent - online version of Office is limited and far too slow (although I can view any Office document using SkyDrive, which is nice since Google sheets and slides can't always render the images well).Overall, I think this is a great product that fills a niche use for me - everyday use at home and going out to a cafe to work.  It's definitely a value play and can't deliver on all the features I need for business, but they don't market it as such anyway.  I never use this without being on a network, so I can't comment on its offline utility.  I'd buy this again in a second.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: jQuery Rocks
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with this device.  The screen is pretty high-res, the keyboard is comfortable to type with, and it's incredibly light.  I have plenty of cloud services and apps I use, so I can actually use this device much of the time, without having to fall back to my Mac or PC.As long as you have a full PC or Mac, this device is epic.  If you don't have another computer, and don't use many cloud apps, this probably isn't the device for you - but for my purposes, I'm thrilled with it.

Reviews.Title: Good, should get better
Reviews.Author: kenryan
Reviews.Content: I was eager to leave greedy Microsoft and Apple behind, so when the price of Chromebooks got reasonable I bought one. So far, so good, and with the continuing development it should get better, unlike the others that clog up and expect you to constantly pay to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Fast, great keyboard
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: Would be 5 stars but for one software glitch with saving documents that Google has been working on. Google techs have been very responsive and have showed me a workaround. Otherwise, product has been outstanding..... fast, good screen, great battery life.

Reviews.Title: The future of personal computing
Reviews.Author: Mohawkman "Mohawkman"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung Chromebook out of curiosity and a sense the Google was on to something with this totally web-based environment.  I bought it to replace my outdated Mac Mini as a second computer.  The Chromebook works pretty much as advertised.  Boots quickly.  Plenty of free apps available.  The screen is small and sometimes hard to see.  The touchpad is sometimes a little too sensitive and it could use more USB ports and an Ethernet port.  I've experienced a few weird crashes on a tab but nothing serious.  The spreadsheet program will not open Excel files with an xlsm extension.  Overall, I'm sold on Google's concept and a bought one for my son who is in college.

Reviews.Title: On the bandwagon
Reviews.Author: Anton C. Johnson "2DBone"
Reviews.Content: This fits the needs for my 11 year old; You Tube, school papers and research.  Very secure and the OS is always current.Check out any review, it is a must for any family. Price is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great for it intended uses
Reviews.Author: Mitchell Young "Mitch Young"
Reviews.Content: I have been packing this computer with me for school and work and it is a wonderful tool to have. Perfect size and weight for what it is able to do.

Reviews.Title: Sweet little machine, questionable reliability, lackluster service
Reviews.Author: grrlpup
Reviews.Content: I've been very happy with my Chromebook. It's lightweight and the keyboard feels good to type on. The dimensions of the screen make for some smallish typefaces while web-browsing, at least at default settings, but the screen is clear and I'm not constantly running out of room or having to scroll. Processing is fast enough for me, even when i have seven or eight tabs open. Non-HD video plays fine.A month or two after I got the Chromebook, the battery wouldn't charge, and the little charging light wouldn't light up. I think I'm pretty careful with it and don't travel around with it in a bag or anything, so I'm a little concerned about the Chromebook's durability. The charging jack almost has to be forced a little; it's not the smoothest-working.The Samsung website does not make it easy or convenient to open a repair ticket. Even though the Chromebook is under warranty, I had to pay shipping to the Texas repair facility. They did not keep me updated about receiving the Chromebook or where it was in the repair process. I could track it on the website, once I found the obscure corner where it could be looked up.The scheduled repair date was several days after they had received the package. The actual repair date was a day or two after scheduled, with no explanation. Overall, they seemed to be in no hurry and feel no obligation to keep me updated. The website asked for my feedback, but only in limited and annoying ways (e.g., a pop-up that obscured the screen I was trying to look at to ask me how helpful it had been).The impression I'm left with: the Chromebook is good for as long as it's good, but Samsung customer service is nothing to inspire brand loyalty.

Reviews.Title: bloggers on budget, go get it
Reviews.Author: Katya W. Mills
Reviews.Content: I got the samsung chromebook last november, open box @ best buy. I am a blogger and laptop enthusiast. This chromebook has afforded me the ability to post to my blogs while i have been mobile. Starts up in seconds. (You must have a wifi connection, okay, I use my phone as a hotspot if I cannot pick up a signal). Online in seconds. You can operate with ten tabs open, but I try not to go over five tabs. Two for my blogs, two for social media, and maybe one wild card. Those of you who appreciate all that google offers, will most benefit from this computer. Those of you who are mobile, and need a lightweight computer which is also surprisingly sturdy. My chromebook has fallen twice from a height of four feet to the ground, and my heart jumped into my throat! It withstood the abuse. Writers! this keyboard and setup rivals mac airbooks. I took my chromebook into a mac store in portland oregon, last february, and the employees there were amazed. The pricetag comp is hundreds of dollars saved. Netflix and youtube enthusiasts: guess what? This baby hooks into flatscreens with the HDMI port, no problem. Pandora enthusiasts? I have my Harman K tuner connected through the headphone jack with a 2:1 cord through the video 3 out. I can play google play and pandora through my system that way. If you are on a budget, you will not be disappointed. Bloggers, no time wasted with Windows updates and antivirus scans. Updates here are seamless and so far no need for antivirus though i do have the avast plugin through google chrome and that's all i seem to need. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great For Travel
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A Bowler
Reviews.Content: I have been using the the Samsung Chromebook for about seven months and I can not find much to complain about.  If you are going to purchase the Chromebook you must consider that for the device to be usable you must have a wireless Internet connection.  The more accustomed you are to google's services the more you will get out of the device.  So if you use gmail, google drive, google docs and everything else google the device is great.  If you want to write a Python script, bring up a command line terminal or analyze a packet capture, buy something else.  Bottom line, if you use google services and have an Android phone, buy the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT FOR MY NEEDS!
Reviews.Author: jennifer neargardner
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop I could take with me on vacation and still connect to my university and social media.  I pulled it out of the box, plugged it in, and within 2-3 minutes I was online and accessing everything I needed.  I plan to give this to my 17 year old Senior for her final year of high school.  This is perfect for everyday use, easy, easy to use and loaded with all the necessary extras.  The battery lasts 7-8 hours and charges quickly.  I'm so glad I made this purchase.  I will be buying another one!!!

Reviews.Title: Good for it's intended - fast wifi web connected - simple use scenario. Not a replacement laptop for very many.
Reviews.Author: otto
Reviews.Content: Good for it's intended - fast wifi web connected - simple use scenario. Not a replacement laptop for very many. Read the other reviews and missives. It's used for travel because of it's compactness. You can remote access into another computer and access a "local" file not uploaded to Google, or to remotely run an application. We've driven a Mac remotely from this Samsung; although I wouldn't want to for any significant length of time.It's cheap plastic, and the corners unsnap. So far they snap back into place. But for $265., it's OK.

Reviews.Title: Good...but why no delete key??
Reviews.Author: Korey
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fast, easy, convenient, maintenance-free. All the functionality I need in a non-gaming machine.Cons: Not having full, Windows-like driver functionality for all-in-one printers.No Delete key.Other Thoughts: I'm sold on Chrome OS for my work needs. I don't fling red birds or waste time on social media sites, but I do use Google Drive and the Zoho office suites extensively. I do some light photo editing and create line drawings as necessary for my job.I like having access to my files from anywhere. A huge bonus is not having to concern myself with updates, patches, anti-virus software, or even software installation.As a technical writer, I'm used to my keyboard layout. I can deal with no Caps Lock key, but I need my Delete key. Not including one makes no sense. It doesn't quite smack of Microsoft's arrogance with regard to Windows 8, but the "Google knows best" attitude can take a hike. I've gotten enough of that attitude from the other two major players. I can safely say that -I'm- the only one who best understands my computing needs.The unit itself is zippy and easy to set up and customize. When the second-generation Chromebook Pixel with Intel's Haswell processor hits the streets, I intend to buy one--but only if the keyboard sports a Delete key.

Reviews.Title: I understand the love hate relationship with this...this is best for usage w/ Cell phones in my opinion and for
Reviews.Author: Ms. Grace
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is not your friend when the system is done.  I think this whole apps thing is just not good at all.  The hope is that you can get a piece that can make this like a wired product.This works more like a smartphone, that resembles a netbook/laptop without the continued service. Unless it is my area of town/state, etc.., sometimes, it goes out.  I was having the problem until I switched my box, but for this chromebook, it still was going out.  So, I see why there are so many of these popping up and for a great deal.My thoughts, if you are super computer savvy and are into playing games, social networking, which I know this is what it was geared toward then this is the item for you.  If you are "in the clouds," it is for you (i.e. music, electronic books, etc.).I am okay, I'm using it now, but I too am having issues with downloading and/or being able to use word and other docs.  I too, was hoping to be able to wirelessly be able to print, but it isn't working.  So, I'm not truly doing everything I expected.My plans were to be able to use this and upgrade from the IBM Thinkpad laptop, I bought last year, to be able to use it for school and other than, trying to do my online discussion, check email and write reviews here, or shop, I'm not having the success I wanted/need while in bed, I still have to use the desktop....wondering abou the Thinkpad?  Well, for some reason having internet connection issues with it...so I don't know, it's craziness, but I hope you are able to do all you want/can with this.

Reviews.Title: Just right for web surfing and email
Reviews.Author: Dachshund Mom
Reviews.Content: Bought the Google Chrome for my husband to web surf while I used my laptop. The Chrome is so fast and easy to use that I find myself using it rather than my laptop. We take it along on our travels; very easy to put in my purse - granted a big purse; lightweight and thin. The screen clarity is outstanding especially video. Sound quality is okay. I use Google docs for some work functions so now use the Chrome to work at home.  This is a value purchase for anyone wanting a portable devise to web surf, watch web streaming videos, use Google docs, check emails.

Reviews.Title: My wife stole this from me........
Reviews.Author: Anthony B. Vander Heyden
Reviews.Content: This is a great little net book. So good that after my wife got her hands on it, I never got it back. She kept saying "This is just what I wanted". Simple, easy to use, very light, great battery life (over 6 hours), almost instant start, no worry about viruses, multiple user logons..............well, I could just go on and on. GREAT little PC not bogged down by Microsoft or all the addons you need for a Windows PC. But don't let you wife touch it......you'll lose it.

Reviews.Title: Amazon does it again!
Reviews.Author: caspersmom
Reviews.Content: I'm really liking this Chromebook! Perfect size for carrying from room to room, fast surfing speed, and it has great picture quality. But what really impresses me the most is Amazon's service. First, I ordered this from their Warehouse Deals dept. as used, but there isn't a mark on it. Looks new to me. Plus, I ordered it on Wednesday evening & had it on Friday. And that was with econo Super Saver shipping! Thanks again, Amazon. I've never received anything but the best in quality merchandise and service from you. I love you, man!

Reviews.Title: Cool and getter cooler
Reviews.Author: A. Muttart "Drew Pierce"
Reviews.Content: Long time listener, first time reviewer.This little puppy is awesome in many ways. And frustrating in others, and the reasons are very similar! Confused? Here's why... everything you love and hate about PCs and Macs are gone. Poof. Bulky, proprietary operating systems and software...gone. CD/DVD drive...gone. The desktop as you know it...gone. Introducing....browser-based EVERYTHING. Weird.I bought this for work knowing that 99% of what we use for business applications are cloud-based. Office365, Salesforce, Smartsheet. If you need the security blanket of OS X, Windows, Outlook, etc, go elsewhere.So with all these caviats, I give this little guy 5 stars because I'm excited for his future. That's a new concept in personal computing...better performance tomorrow than today. As Google pours more resources in the cloud-based OS, my computer will directly benefit...transparently...over time. And I can't over-emphasize the piece of mind knowing that I need not give a damn about patching, anti-virus, updates...gone.Know your needs. Also know that if you're ready for it, this is $250 extraordinarily well spent.

Reviews.Title: Best Computer I've Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Locicero "nicklocicero"
Reviews.Content: This computer is simply amazing.  I can give it 5 stars without a second thought.Now, for anyone who is not very good with computers, this is a great choice because it is very simple.  Just a web browser.The battery lasts 9 hours without a problem.The screen is great.The computer boots up in no time.  8 seconds, that's it.  If you're like me, once I've turned a computer off I go, "Ahh, I forgot to do that one thing.  Oh well, the computer is off now."  But not with this.  I just pop it on and bang.  Done in less than 60 seconds.But where the 5 stars really comes in is simple.  I put my Chromebook in developer mode and installed linux.  I have access to Gedit, the terminal, everything any normal linux computer would have.  And it very stable.It is so fast for only $200, I can't believe it.Oh, and it looks exactly like a MacBook Air.  Everyone here in the library is eyeing and everyone asks about it.If you're not super savvy, but a little savvy, this might be a boring computer for you because installing linux and not having access to software outside of dev mode may be frustrating.  But I'm not a genius and I figured it out.Thank you, Google!!

Reviews.Title: Had for about three months
Reviews.Author: john Lampe
Reviews.Content: Very light, starts up lightning fast, keyboard pretty nice and screen average to good. I download movies to a flash drive and plug into the back USB ports. Reads and plays back faster than any tablet or laptop I have. WiFi range is great.  Bought another for my daughter to use at home.Update 5.30.2013.....plays movies well, but will not play MKV video files.Update 6.3.2013......hooked up two small USB driven speakers. Played fine  ......hooked up 500 gigabyte USB driven external hard drive. Found and played  all MP3 music files. Player is very basic and shows only names.Not  cover art/images.

Reviews.Title: sleek, fast , functional!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "norway"
Reviews.Content: THis machine is sleek,thin,not even 2lbs, toss it in your bag and go! It is a highly efficient web browser, you will be working "in the cloud" and this may take a little getting used to...so read reviews and know what it does, what it can do and what you really need it for....I use it to surf the net, email , I store my pics in the Cloud, and I love to watch Netflix or Hulu, no problems, the key board is great, its cool and quiet.....I have no complaints at all, I knew what I wanted and it has turned out just as I hoped! Saved a huge chunk of money not buying a bloated laptop with tons of stuff I will never use!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality for the Right User
Reviews.Author: Elliot Badar
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, let me say that I absolutely love this computer.  I have had it for several months now, and it does everything I need it to while still holding a charge for almost the entire day.Now, I will qualify my statement by saying that this computer is not for everyone.  It is for people who are already familiar with the Google Drive suite of tools, as well as many other cloud-based services.  If you are looking for something to replace your Windows or Mac laptop, you will be left somewhat short.  Basically, apart from word processing, spreadsheets, and presentations, the Chromebook has "dumbed down" online versions of other applications.Basically, if you know what you're doing and you're comfortable working with cloud applications, you cannot beat the Chromebook.  Between the computer itself, the 2 years of 100Gb Google Drive, and the gogo wifi passes, it is well worth the $250.  The keyboard is a great size, it is small and light, and the battery life is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Religious conversion
Reviews.Author: Erik J S
Reviews.Content: My mac died. It took some data with it. Not much, but I was annoyed.I guess I could have gotten the icloud, or a time machine thingy. Effort/money. Bah.My mac cost 2000$ and lasted 6 years, 333 dollars a year. If this chromebook lasts 2 years that'll be 125 a year, and I can throw it in the trash and not lose any data since it uses the google cloud idrive jobby. Did I mention the free google drive space? That comes with it. You cannot beat this price, people!Here's a list of reasons it is superior to my old laptop, in no particular order.- it's lighter. My work laptop weighs so much more, this thing is not noticable.- it's (thermally) cooler- I can hook the hdmi up to my TV and watch netflix- the battery seems to last a long time- no caps lock key, i've always hated the caps lock.- no 'f' keys. "F"- them! What is "F4"? A worthless computer shibboleth for lording over users and their ignorant comrades. There are dedicated keys for windowing, and other settings.- The keystrokes feel wonderful. In fairness apple switched to these keys.- no optical drive. I don't need that any more.- no need to hook up my phone to get photos. I push them into the google drive when I take them. They are available whenever I open the chromebook lid.- The trackpad is .. I dunno, supple. flicking around, clicking and right clicking are so nice. I hate the dell trackpads more than ever.- There's no such thing as crapware on this thing.Here's a list of CONS!- google docs doesn't keep the cursor in the right position if you ctrl+ (zoom) the window. Pretty bush league!!- If you open a document in gdocs, it opens a google drive window. Then clicking the document opens another gdoc window. Three windows! Duh.Since these cons only have to do with google docs, I can still give this thing 5 stars. The audio jack is a bit stiff when I tried [un]plugging a std 1/4 inch tip stereo headphone in. Is that a problem? No.Wait, I thought of a con.- you can't see a calendar by clicking on the time. You get dumped into the settings interface for picking your damn time zone. Stick a freaking calendar on that thing google! Of course, they won't because they want to hawk their stupid calendar app.Still, 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: For everyone, they just don't know it yet
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: When I first got my Chromebook, my brother just brushed it off out of jealousy saying,"its just a tablet with a keyboard." This is the guy that spends most of his PC time paying bills or watching Netflix, which is what most people do but don't admit it. Everyone tries to be Tony Stark and "require" massive computing power when the truth is that half the time we really don't need it. I feel the average person only really needs about 2gb of memory in their out and about laptop.I know a few tech junkies who fiddle with computers and THEY want one.I may just have a chip on my shoulder because of what my brother said but here is an article that pretty much covers my feelings on the Chromebook.http://www.pcworld.com/article/2030096/how-i-survived-7-days-in-chromebook-exile.html

Reviews.Title: It is all I am ever on now!
Reviews.Author: Poweena
Reviews.Content: I've had a few laptops in the past but this one is so thin, light and comes with everything I ever needed! I love the wifi capability, the many many apps you can add, and especially the price! This was definitely a good deal for a fantastic product!

Reviews.Title: LOVE! LOVE!! LOVE!!!
Reviews.Author: Ann L. Lacava "alacava"
Reviews.Content: I had tried the Chrome browser on my desktop and fussed about it---having used Internet Explorer from the very beginning of computer time.  But I DO love Google.  So I tried the Google Nexus--the 7" tablet and finally gave it to my daughter.  I needed something in between.  When I found the Chromebook, I decided to give it a try.  After all, how could you lose at $250?? for a notebook.  After the adjustment period (for instance, no delete key), I was sold.  It is fast, a wonderful size for toting around, with beautiful image.  For that kind of money, you can feel really happy to use it for email and internet and go to the desktop for any production work you might have.

Reviews.Title: nice!
Reviews.Author: KK Chan
Reviews.Content: This computer is very beautiful, streamlined, simple and light. It travels well and never overheats. I would definitely recommend for a travel computer.

Reviews.Title: best lightweight I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Norman Matthews
Reviews.Content: I love this computer.  It is everything I hoped it would be.  I broke my leg last week and I have surgery on it tomorrow.  This makes sitting at my desktop a very difficult task.  Hello Chromebook.  It does everything I need it to do.  I live in Google drive for work and school anyway, so this is just icing on the cake.  Beware:  it is nothing but a browser so if you are offline, you can do nothing but simple word processing.This computer just works.  I'm not a facebook junkie.  I don't watch much tv on a computer (I move to my large screen and comfy leather coach for that).  I generate content as much as I consume content on my computer.  So for that reason the tablets, nice as they are, just don't work for me.  I had a netbook that I run Jolli OS that I really liked, but the hardrive burnt out.  You can't replace that one anymore (it was $250).  This was the next cheapest thing.  What I love the most is the battery life, the incredibly fast boot time (instant if just asleep), and the portability.  The build is a little cheap, but not too bad.  If you are similar to me, then this computer could work well for you. If you want it for watching movies and facebook then you best look at the tablet offerings.

Reviews.Title: Good for business use
Reviews.Author: asiaamariee
Reviews.Content: First off, the laptop is great. It starts up in less than 5 seconds and it connects my google and youtube accounts automatically. But if you do not have wifi, you are limited. This computer does not allow you to download itunes and i cannot edit documents or use excel while offline. Other than that, great product.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Chromebook (Wi-Fi, 11.6-Inch)
Reviews.Author: Herb
Reviews.Content: Had a laptop for long time then there was a lot of talk about the Chromebook so I went and purchased it saying if I didn't like it they could buy it from me. After receiving it then spent next couple days cruising the internet and testing all the apps. I love it! It's much faster, lighter and not so bulky. Never really used the cd drive or allot the gadgets on the laptop but basically just internet so this is perfect to my needs. Brought it to work to show all the other guys and told them to go and buy their own!

Reviews.Title: Chromebook is my answer...
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: After much research, and debating over which MacBook I wanted, the 11.5 inch or 13 inch Air, or the 13-inch Pro or maybe the 13-inch Retina Pro, I never could decide to spend the money, not because I can't afford it so much as the over-$1000 (and much more with a few tweaks and AppleCare!) is just more of my money than I want to spend for something I'll take to work and on trips and around town.The Chromebook has come to the rescue.  This is the light, take-it-along companion that I need.  I only got it this afternoon.  Already I have loaded pictures and music.  I have watched videos and looked at email.  All very quickly and easily.I look forward to using Google Docs for note-taking at work meetings. What I like about Google apps is that they are straightforward and intuitive.  Honestly, I've never been able to stand Pages for word processing.  It's an example of something that's so intuitive it's somehow become painfully cumbersome to use.  I assume I'm not the only person who feels this way.  Suffice it to say--this is a great gadget.  And Amazon delivered very quickly--thanks!

Reviews.Title: Net surfer
Reviews.Author: The Other Lowery
Reviews.Content: I only use this chromebook for surfing and it's perfect for it. It's a great alternative to ipads ( I love my keyboards)

Reviews.Title: perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Mike Long
Reviews.Content: take it out of the box, open it up, and your using the internet, email, video chat, google drive, etc.  Boots up in seconds, very light, battery life of 4 to 6 hours, depending on what you're doing with it.  All the google software (which replaces conventional programs) works well, is free, and updates automatically.

Reviews.Title: A Writing Tool
Reviews.Author: S. Koch
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews before buying. This device does one thing, and it does it well. Make sure you know what that is before you buy it.I needed a dirt cheap, silent, ice cool, weightless computer to make a portable typewriter for writing fiction. This thing is all of those and more. The problem is that it doesn't do much else. Sure, it browses the internet. And that's about it. No custom programs, some filetypes just won't work. The music player offline sort of sucks, and it was a pain to get my MP3s on here anyways.All that said, it's a writer's dream come true. It boots down and up in under 5 seconds. It goes into and out of sleep mode in about a second flat. The keyboard feels and responds nicely. Writing is comfortable. It lasts me all day without a charge, and charges quickly.I suggest getting one if you need a good cheap internet browser. I wouldn't suggest it if you want an actual laptop. But hey, it's under $300 and no Windows bloatware.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Frequent Buyer
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at first because the price was so low and I figured it would be a "cheap" product.  How wrong I was.  Matter of fact, my  IT professional at work thought it was a great product and he bought one for his mom who just wanted to use the Internet.  I bought mine for the kids to play their Disney and Nick Jr games.  Great travel device.

Reviews.Title: Amazed at the quality for the price! However, VPN problems.
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Update: VPN started working again, so I returned my rating to 5 stars, because I do find this to be an incredible product. VPN seems to be a "work in process" with Google. It is frustrating at times.Update: VPN is highly unreliable with Google Chromebooks. Often the Google updates break VPN, even when VPN is working it is always questionable if it will continue working. If you need reliable and consistent VPN, Chromebook is probably not a wise choice. I have lowered my rating from 5 stars to 2 stars because of Google's apparent lack of interest in fixing VPN. Without VPN, for me, this product is worthless!It's an amazing device for the price. However, I have had some significant VPN connectivity issues. Working with Google support and my VPN provider VPN did seem stable. Now, it is broken again. It is exhausting trying to have VPN work reliability on a Chromebook.When on the road I use mostly email and browsing at hot spots with my own VPN wifi connection.  I find the Chromebook to fit my needs perfectly as a second laptop for this.  Now, I find myself using it around the house.  I've become more and more Google-centric.  I've been in IT/R&D; for years, but I really wanted a simple device that was self-maintaining.  Especially on the road, so this is perfect.  I also wanted to keep my budget low ... can't get much cheaper than this.  Again, I need to state the quality of this Samsung Chromebook is amazing for the price.Hopefully, one day, Google will make fixing VPN a priority. There is a lot of information about this on the internet concerning Chromebooks and VPN issues.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Saumil
Reviews.Content: Well worth the $250 retail. Lightning fast, extremely light, and very durable.  seamless syncing capability with my desktop and mobile phone.

Reviews.Title: Screen is underwhelming, but it's a neat idea.
Reviews.Author: gilbert
Reviews.Content: Obviously it's an inexpensive computer, but I wish they had allowed a nicer screen option -- it's very washed out, and there is no single angle you can look at it and see all the colors correctly.Other than the screen, it's a nice little device. Keyboard and touchpad are great!

Reviews.Title: Great little computer for price, some wifi connectivity issues however.
Reviews.Author: Jason M Duffy
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this is a great little computer, especially if you are familiar with Google's products (gmail, chrome, drive, etc).  PLEASE do your research and know what the computer is capable of doing and not doing.  It's not a complete replacement for a windows/mac PC.My only beef with this upon unboxing and start-up was I kept getting very slow web page load times and even kept getting kicked off my home wifi network (that previously had worked without problems on a PC).  As you can imagine this was very frustrating at first, obviously smooth internet connectivity is crucial to get the most out of a Chromebook.Did some research and found this was not an uncommon problem with this model Chromebook (Samsung 550).  Do a google search for "chomebook wifi connectivity problems" or similar and you'll see what I'm talking about.In short, to fix this I had to tweak 2 of my home WiFi routers settings.  This forced me to educate myself on some WiFi "lingo".FULL DISCLOSURE:  I am not a tech geek, these steps below are just to point you in the right direction if you are having similar issues, not a comprehensive step by step!  Your mileage may vary!1.  To remedy slow page load times, I had to change my encryption settings on my wifi router from WEP (a setting NO ONE should be using, I learned) to WPA2-PSK.  This is a much more secure setting anyway and seems to work with chromebooks that are having very slow page load times running off home wifi (not 3G).2.  To remedy the issue of occasionally (often) losing my wifi connection, I had to change my wifi router's network mode (ie:  b/g/n) to just broadcasting on the g network only.  Apparently if you live in an area where other wifi networks are broadcasting on mixed modes, the Samsung 550s get "confused" and will bump you off.  I have not had any problems connecting to public wifi networks with this machine!Once I made these changes I am rocking just fine on this very low cost, super fast startup, no noisy fan having, seemingly well built machine!

Reviews.Title: Returned it as I wasn't happy with it
Reviews.Author: Mark Nicholson
Reviews.Content: I'd read a glowing review about a tech writer's experience with the Acer Chromebook and decided I'd like to try one and since Samsung is making some great hardware these days I decided to get it instead.I was pretty disappointed with it and with the Chrome OS when it came.  The good news is it's very light, the bad is that it feels somewhat cheap and plastic-y.  I don't like the matte screen at all as things don't look sharp and clear, whether text or images.  I tried hooking it up via HDMI to my 24" ASUS monitor and even there the image quality was poor.  I'm used to Windows and the big monitor and crisp looking images and text and don't want to regress to the level the Chromebook is at.I also didn't like the trackpad.  It had that annoying tendency of jumping the cursor just as you went to click the button part of the pad.  You're better off using the tap to click as that avoids the jumping.  BTW, it seems the trackpads on many of the new devices coming out are a bit flaky.I wasn't impressed with Chrome OS.  It didn't seem snappy or fast or robust.  Once again it felt like a big regression from using Windows 7 or 8 or Android 4.2.  I kept wanting to touch the screen as I'm spoiled by touch enabled devices and thought how much I'd rather just spend a little more (well actually about double more) and get a Windows 8 touchscreen device.  I also own a Nexus 7 and 4 and I'm very happy with Android so it's not just a Window's bias.The best thing I can say about the Samsung Chromebook is that it is light and portable.

Reviews.Title: For $250, this is a fantastic machine
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: I was going to purchase this from Amazon but the price went up. So I went to Best Buy to get it for $250.I have a MacBook Pro but wanted a netbook for classes that was light and convenient for on the go. My iPad mini is too difficult for typing notes.I was able to use a MacBook Pro silicone keyboard protector for the Chromebook, but I had to trim the edges. They keys are very much like a Mac's, which is another reason I decided to go with this instead of a typical Acer netbook. Much easier for me on switching between laptops.I ignored any of the poor reviews about the video playback because I didn't need that. The screen is odd to me. The closest thing I can think of to describe it is that it's like an LCD TV. Very matte but sharp in a way. Check it out at Best Buy to see if it bothers you or not. The Acer Chromebook has a glass-like screen which I would have preferred. But this had better specs: 6.5 hrs battery life + 2.4 lbs vs. 3 hrs + 3 lbs.I wasn't too familiar with Chrome OS, but I had the browser on my Macbook. It syncs up pretty well and all of my bookmarks/apps/history/cache transferred nicely (the browser is attached to the google account you use for the browser/GDrive). I'd recommend downloading and playing around with the Chrome Browser to see if you are okay using it. The OS seems to be completely based around the Chrome browser and its apps.The speakers are surprisingly strong and are under the laptop near the front feet. Gives it a surround-sound feeling.It's somewhat difficult for me to open compared to my MacBook. I'm still looking for a good cover to put on this, but I suppose I'll have to wait until the market share goes up.Overall, I absolutely love my new laptop and Google Drive is working great for my note-taking.Hope this helps!*UPDATE*I've been having problems with the machine not waking up from sleep. The power button is lit but the screen is asleep. I had to hold the power button until the machine turns off... and then turn it back on.Many others have this problem and the current go-arounds are switching to the beta channel (since Google is aware of the problem and apparently fixed it in the next update) or logging off before you close it (which I prefer... but looking forward to the update).My two cents:Keep in mind that this, much like other programs, is a work in progress and requires a certain amount of patience and perspective. Google isn't afraid to have people experimenting with the products to make them better. Contrary to other unhappy users, I don't feel as if Google/Samsung have cheated me in any way and I think the pros are outweighing the cons. I mean, why do people think there are always new versions of everything? Mac OSX 10.8.2, Windows 8, etc. There will always be bugs that will have to be worked out and Chrome is a young OS. If anything, I feel like we're helping the OS reach its potential.*UPDATE* (6 months later)I haven't had problems with the Chromebook since the sleep problem and that was fixed a week after I wrote that.The Chromebook has been working just fine!

Reviews.Title: Beware of printer hook-up
Reviews.Author: Buyer127
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Chromebook itself works well and is reasonably responsive for light to moderate internet use. But its instructions say you cannot print by plugging your printer into one of the two USB ports. If you have a printer with the Google Cloud Print feature, you are in good shape. I do not. I could make it print only by routing the print order through a Windows laptop, which then sent it to the printer. Quite cumbersome and a hassle to set up. All 3 devices are in a wireless network.Follow0up comment regarding Chrome Remote Desktop app: The Chromebook advises (as of 1/30/13) to "stay tuned" for an important feature of Remote Desktop -- the ability to access the Chromebook desktop from a remote PC or Mac. So you're out of luck for an unknown amount of time if you want to provide a little tech support to a friend or relative by taking control of their Samsung Chromebook remotely. This is a pain and a huge and unexpected disappointment. Also, TeamViewer, a free remote access program, doesn't run on the Chrome OS, so it's no help in this situation either.

Reviews.Title: exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: blenderbender
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a Dell mini 10 netbook that I hated with a passion. It has performed beyond my expectations in that regard nearly flawlessly. There have a been a few little hiccups as with any computer but nothing like I experienced with the PC and associated windows issues. I love the 8-9 second boot time and no anti virus BS!!! If you can live with "in the cloud" computing this is a winner by my standards. Of course I wouldn't mind an even better price than the $249 I paid. No regrets here!

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Johannak
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy! I love everything about it. If you're looking for a thin, lightweight laptop without all the Windows junk and virus threats this is perfect!I took it out of the box and it fired right up! Which is a huge change from my old clunky laptop that would take 5 minutes to get up and going!I love the Google Hangout feature. It's awesome to be able to video chat with my friends and family across the country.If you're looking for a new/second computer this is perfect! I'm so glad I made the decision to get one!

Reviews.Title: The laptop I've been waiting for
Reviews.Author: johnnycab
Reviews.Content: The good:- Great matte screen!- Nice keyboard and touchpad- No fan: silent, runs cool- Light & sleek form factor- Long battery life- Wakes up quickly from sleepThe bad:- Google hasn't yet (Dec 2012) updated Chrome to work fully on ARM processors, so you can't watch Netflix on hereSeriously, if you understand what Chrome OS is and what you'd use it for, you're likely to love this computer as much as I do.If you're clueless about 'the cloud' (and computers in general) and do nothing but surf, you'll also love this computer.If you're in the middle somewhere and still use dinosaur apps like Word or Excel (instead of Google Docs) and like to print your emails, you should probably take a pass.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Harvey Pashibin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little machine for the price.  Amazing video clarity, ease of use....and for its size...the audio is quite good.  The 6-plus hour battery life allows for portability without the hassle of recharging during extended use.

Reviews.Title: I read every review
Reviews.Author: ilrn2
Reviews.Content: Though skeptical after reading every review on low price PCs (yes, I'm retired and have only SS income,) I was betting on  Amazon's return policy as my backup. After less than 1 week the Samsung Chromebook would not open and I'm disappointedly returning this decent slim little machine. All the good attributes in the reviews are generally, true, but the truth of how "unreliable" ths Samsung product is very reliable. With video, it would be a gift to rate it 2". STAY AWAY 4 NOW!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome on-the-go laptop
Reviews.Author: karson
Reviews.Content: I was in rather desperate need of a laptop, but on my very strict budget my choices were limited. After my last Samsung laptop broke within a week, I was hesitant but this laptop has exceeded my expectations. My new job has me always on the go and this little, sturdy lightweight laptop is perfect for me. ChromeOS is very fast and forgiving of weak WiFi connections and Google Docs has been able to fill in for most of MS office (the exception being complicated Excel spreadsheets). The HDMI output is impressive for the hardware, and the computer is completely silent (no fans). I wouldn't recommend this as a gaming laptop, and offline capabilities are extremely limited, but for browsing the internet, writing, streaming media, etc. it works excellently.

Reviews.Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Mentat
Reviews.Content: I have a 4 month old Samsung Chromebook, that crashes every 2-5 minutes. I have restored the device multiple times, but it continues to restart. I then returned it to Samsung for a diagnosis, and they returned it back to me, stating that they couldn't replicate the crash. So I have it now and it still crashes every 2-5 minutes.  Samsung refuses to take it back.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook the laptop alternative
Reviews.Author: DeeAnn Pfundt
Reviews.Content: I could not be more happy with this product. It is absolutely fabulous. I have been using it every day for over week now. It really can do just about anything my laptop could do, as well as my desktop.  A desktop is required for storage, burning DVD's and the like as there is no optical drive on the Chromebook. The hard drive is also very small, by today's standards.However, with the available Chrome extensions; tasks such as documents, spread sheets, reading books and basic computer games are all a breeze. Not to mention of course, the internet and email.Battery life is amazing. Upon getting it, I charged it, once it was fully charged, it lasted 2-1/2 days of off and on use for hours at a time - battery was down to 34%. Charging it is also quite fast. At that point, it took 1-1/2 hours to fully charge *while* using it!Set up? There is none. Turn it on, if you are good to go. If you are already a Chrome user, everything is right there for you. There are some minor adjustments/tweaking you can make such as desktop background, font size and scrolling method. It really could not be more simple.The screen size, 11.7" is quite adequate, the touch pad is HUGE and very easy to navigate even for me who has always had a problem using touch pads. Not with this. It takes a few times to learn the finger(s) gestures for right click type commands, but from then on, it's a breeze. I did try using a USB mouse and it worked, but it was a bit sluggish. But again, it is quite easy to navigate using the touchpad and I really have not needed to use a mouse.At 2.4 pounds and less than 1/2" thick, I am looking forward to putting this in my backpack on my next vacation as opposed to the Netbook or laptop!  I had read some reviews that the case scratches easily? So far, I've not found that to be true. But then, I am not a child and do use care when using my electronics. I bought the Case Logic LAPS-111 sleeve and it fits snugly and was a good investment since it doesn't add much to the size of the Chromebook, yet offers more than enough protection.Two days after getting this, I sold my laptop and Netbook - there was no need for either. I love that as soon as you open the lid,it is instant on. I really cannot say enough good things about this product.  If you're on the fence about buying one of these? JUMP, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: A computer for the 95% of us
Reviews.Author: M. Damm
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short:  I simply love this little gadget.  This is our 3rd Chromebook over the years, and easily the best one.  Looks similar to a Macbook Pro.Very very fast.The perfect computer for people who don't like computers....they just keep on trucking, no problems, or constant updates.

Reviews.Title: Delighted
Reviews.Author: Jim Burke
Reviews.Content: My Chromebook 3 was delivered on November 26. I've had no issues whatsoever . . . this is one beautiful and functional device. Having read the reviews and specifications before I bought, I was aware of the limitations, but I've found it does 95 percent of what I need in a fast and user-friendly way. If I should occasionally need to do something that requires heavy-duty processing power, then I'll simply borrow my wife's MacBook Pro.BTW, the opened machine has been knocked on the floor twice by a passing dog with no damage to exterior or functionality. Pleasant surprise! :)I smile when I hear reviews that call this just a child's machine. Nonsense, this is a cost-effective way of researching . . . listening, gathering information, and sharing with the world. It is capable of doing the work that most of us have to do. It is perhaps not for everyone, but definitely for many.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Paola
Reviews.Content: Great! Easy to set up and use. Perfect for my constant online shopping and pining. So light and easy to handle. Great battery life. Love that it stays cool even after hours of use.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Chromebook (Notebook)
Reviews.Author: Monica Apolinar
Reviews.Content: An awesome notebook to carry around in your backpack, great for college students. You have to read the instructions though, because it's different from other notebooks, have to get apps for it. Not like a windows computer.

Reviews.Title: Hinge problem
Reviews.Author: Manna Lua
Reviews.Content: I couldn't wait to tear the box open this am, like a kid at christmas. I looked it over and oh-o, the right hinge was misaligned. I have had hinge problems with lap tops before and won't tolerate that again. I did the chat thing with Samsung and they asked for pictures which I sent and half an hour later "Phillip" told me he "checked that the hinge is slightly displaced". He then advised me to file a service request but first I had to register my Chromebook with Samsung. Now I'm having trouble filing a service request. The serial number field (required) won't accept keyboard input. This S$$it Plsses me off!Overall build quality though is fine from my point of view.. The keyboard is OK, spacing between the keys is even a little too far. The track pad I haven't quite gotten used to yet but I think it'll be OK. The flex, cheapness, plasticy comments I heard about I don't agree with, but Im not keen on twisting or flexing a computer.Otherwise, I think this little job here is fantastic. The google side of it seems to work well. I am a long time Chrome user and my chromebook desktop is now identical to the one on my laptop. All I had to do was log in to my gmail account and presto. The 100g google drive offer is currently unavailable for some reason but I'll get to that later.I haven't figured out where the delete key is yet.The SD card does stick out a bit but no big deal.I've been working on it on battery power for 45 minutes or so after a full charge and I have 91% left.The business end of the charger is a bit of a throwback, why couldn't they have used micro USB?So far, for the first couple hours, that's it

Reviews.Title: Samsung Chromebook - Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: @shannonkjohns
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Chromebook for my daughter and when I tried registering the product on Samsung's website, I noticed that the product did not have a serial number attached on the unit. Opened a ticket with Samsung and emailed Amazon receipt for proof of purchase. When the screen started to show signs of going out (only after three months of use), I shipped the unit to Texas for Samsung to fix. Upon arrival, Samsung took a photo of the bottom of the unit where the serial number should be and voided the warranty due to no serial number on the unit. Now, unit is en route back to me without it being fixed.Kudos to Amazon for taking the product as a return and offering a full refund. As for Samsung, you lost me as a customer.

Reviews.Title: Nice for what it does.
Reviews.Author: Stephen Hester
Reviews.Content: Great for what it does.  Fast boot, long battery life and virus free.  Great for a quick search, banking, or shopping.  Seems to be easier to search on than an iPad due to keyboard and more PC type use.  I like it and if you can work with its limitations (needing wifi for most everything) it does the job well.  Very light.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Replacement
Reviews.Author: JoinThe1
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after my Macbook Pro broke.  I was concerned with the low price, but it has worked wonderfully for my needs.  It takes some time to get used to not being to just open an application, and only being able to use the Chrome Browser.  After a couple weeks, I was finally able to understand how to do much more than just browse the web! The extra Google Drive space has come in handy to access all of my files, and use the Google document, spreadsheet, and slideshow tools to work on the things I need done.  My other concern was that it would be slow, but I have been able to have over a dozen tabs open, and continue to work at full speed.  The USB ports, and SD card slot, have worked well to transfer and share files as well.  Very happy with this purchase, just be sure to realize the limitations you will have.  If you need a small computer for travel, (You get 12 free Gogo Inflight Sessions to use as well!) this Chromebook fits the bill.  Even when you can't just load up Microsoft Word, or a specific photo editing program, there is a way to get it done-just have to figure it out!

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Water Bearer "Aquarius"
Reviews.Content: I've had my Chromebook since last spring. I read many reviews before I made my purchase, so I already knew what I was getting. I have a Windows 7 desktop and 2 Sony laptops, so I really didn't need my Chromebook for the functions for which I use my regular computers (mostly image and video editing). I needed a fast and simple path online and something more portable than my laptops, but still with a full-size keyboard. My Chromebook was the perfect solution. It starts almost instantly, and I'm online before my other computers are finished booting. It's very light and perfect for travel, and I have been getting more than 6 hours of use from the battery-- sometimes even 7 hours. I'm very happy with the suite of Google applications included. I had never used GoogleDocs before, but I found it easy to use, and for me, preferable to Word. I like that I can export from the Google applications to Microsoft applications if I need to, but mostly I simply keep my documents online in my GoogleDrive-- which I also love. With the Android GoogleDrive app on my phone, I have access to my files all of the time. The Chromebook is fast enough when I am surfing online, and I have never had any problems-- even with watching HD movies on Netflix. It is very convenient that the Chromebook has 2 USB ports (1 USB 3.0), an SD card slot, and an HDMI port. My USB ports instantly recognized my terabyte portable drive and every other USB storage device that I connected (also my wireless mouse, which I prefer over the trackpad). The HDMI port means that I don't need any other device to stream movies to my high definition television. I simply plug in my Chromebook into a TV HDMI port, and I'm ready to go. The Chrome operating system has been much improved (as promised) since I bought my Chromebook. Originally, the picture viewer would frequently hang up when viewing a large number of files, and the movie player couldn't play .AVI movies from my external drive without sputtering and skipping frames. After several automatic updates, both issues have been completely resolved. (The music player does not play .wma files, so you will have to convert them to .mp3.) I'm very happy with my Chromebook. It has delivered everything that it promised.

Reviews.Title: A simple, flexible and excellent device for accessing the internet
Reviews.Author: angela h.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a device that had a larger screen when I was doing home visits.  I had consider a net book but did not want to spend $800- $1000.  After looking at reviews,  I decided to purchase a chromebook.  It is very light and has a long lasting battery.  It also does not get very hot since it has a solid state drive.  When looking at reviews, you have to keep in mind that the Chrome Os is just a browser and therefore you will not be able to use things that requires a driver/software (i.e scanner) and that it not suppose to be a primary computer/laptop.  But the Samsung 3G, WiFi chromebook works perfect as a portable internet portal.  The 3G is via Verizon and I purchase 1  GB for $20 per month because I use up the free monthly 100 MB.  But I never come close to using the 1 GB.  I also do not have to worry about antivirus and maintenance.  And since I do not store any sensitive info on the drive (I use the google drive), I do not have to worry about my client's info if the chromebook is lost or stolen.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for an Old Dog Like Me
Reviews.Author: M. Yu
Reviews.Content: As iPad and tablet computers and cell phone with ever bigger screens take over more and more of the laptop market, I am so glad to have found the Chromebook, especially this little Samsung!  Here are some observations I have about this little gem:*  Fast doesn't describe how quickly it boots up and gets on the internet.  To me it's almost instantaneous!*  The screen is bright but the color is a little washed out.*  Keyboard is fantastic but missing cap lock?!  There are a ton of keyboard short-cuts (remember WordPrefect?  Yeah, it's like that!)*  Touchpad is decent but has no buttons.  The gestures are a little different than Windows/Mac.  Will take some getting use to.*  Light weight because of mostly plastic materials.  Doesn't scream cheap but it may not hold up too well in the long run.  However I do love the design.*  The screen hinge is on top so the screen won't open all the way flat (viewing angle is still good thou).*  Battery charges fully in about 2 hours and last about 4 hours watching mostly videos.*  Video runs smoothly.*  Great WIFI antenna.*  Gets a little warm sitting on the lap.For me, both the Apple iPad and the Android tablets failed to become my full-time computer replacement.  Yet, at the same time I found myself needing less than a full fledge computer for the casual web surfing and basic word processing functions.  The Chromebook hit that sweet spot perfectly and at just the right price!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: leo24
Reviews.Content: It's extremely affordable and for some one who only uses word document and surfs the web it's perfect. It still presents videos in HD... for netflix users, and you can work seamlessly without it lagging on you, even with multiple tabs open on the browser. For some one on a budget like myself or for some one who doesn't want to spend a fortune... this chromebook is for you.

Reviews.Title: I love it, and I'm so glad I bought one!
Reviews.Author: Eric C Mueller
Reviews.Content: This thing is excellent for the price - very light, long battery life, nice keyboard.I do development on mine, using a cloud server - the ssh apps in the chrome store are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Ok for what it is.
Reviews.Author: Gary Sparks
Reviews.Content: Its ok, but not really what what I thought it would do. Great for the internet, not much use for more than that for me.

Reviews.Title: Perfect second computer
Reviews.Author: Prisoner zero
Reviews.Content: Shipped fast. Arrived in good condition. My second Chromebook. Had a first gen as well.  Cheaper and more functional than a tablet. Makes a great guest computer since each user logs on using their gmail . I don't have to worry about others users looking at my data or changing my settings. No anti virus needed, no maintenance,SSD boots up super fast. Thinking of buying one for my elderly mother since it's so simple to use. I would recommend Samsung products and Google/chromebooks  to anyone needing a simple web browsing experience.

Reviews.Title: Looks Great But Performs Terribly
Reviews.Author: Arjun Aggarwal
Reviews.Content: I love Google products and had been itching to get a Chromebook for a long time. Even though they are relatively cheap compared to full-fledged laptops, given the minimal abilities of Chrome OS, I wasn't willing to buy a Chromebook until this sale came long. The price was great, and I received the product without delay and boy was it beautiful. Slim, light, well designed. The build quality wasn't the greatest, but it was a $250 retail product, so I wasn't expecting much.But then I turned it on and opened up a few tabs as I normally would on my regular Macbook Pro -- nothing too computationally intensive, just Gmail, Facebook, and ESPN...before I knew it, the computer was STRUGGLING. I couldn't switch between those three tabs without lag. They say Chromebooks are meant for light usage and web browsing, but I don't know ANYONE who ever only has one tab open on a browser at one time, and it seems like that's all this Samsung Chromebook can handle with the processor it has. If you like to switch quickly between tabs or stream music while doing emails or reading the news, this Samsung Chromebook is NOT for you -- I don't think its a product of the Chrome OS necessarily, so maybe look for a more powerful Chromebook.All in all, this Chromebook is all beauty but no brains - web surfers, emailers, news readers, music listeners, look somewhere else for a light, cheap alternative...there are PLENTY out there, whether they are another type of Chromebook or a Windows laptop.

Reviews.Title: Love Love My Chromebook!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Marcella Sammons
Reviews.Content: I needed a new computer and my son recommended that I purchase a Samsung Chromebook.  I am so glad I took his advice.  Now I can see my new granddaughter on google hangout.  Thank you, Marcella

Reviews.Title: I always like samsung products.
Reviews.Author: Mohammad Ranginwala
Reviews.Content: This chrome book is light weight, fast and the battery life is unbelievable.  I really enjoy working on this chrome book.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Heather Chiang
Reviews.Content: So light and aesthetically pleasing!Perfect for my needs, I only use Google (+ all its apps) anyway.I use this for personal usage (Youtube, fb etc) and for class (Google Doc) and it works fine!

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Marjorie Thelen "Author of Deovolante Space O...
Reviews.Content: This is a cool little computer for a college or high school student but I find it's usefulness as a full time writer limited.  It takes getting used to because one always has to be on the internet where files are stored. There are limited applications one can use off line. I find it jumps around a lot. Sometimes it is hard to find the cursor and get it to go where one wants. I use it for workshops or travel to access email, but I wouldn't buy another one.

Reviews.Title: All Students Have to Have One!
Reviews.Author: RichardC
Reviews.Content: This is a web-based operating system that takes getting used to.There are lots of free(that's right free)Chrome apps that can run offline using the Chrome OS platform. If you write; Google Docs is decent, but roll-apps with Open Office Writer is truly amazing. My professors like my papers to be in Times New Roman 12. Upon request, the next time I loaded the app it was set as my default. If you have a gmail account, and you have never signed into Chrome, you're missing out.The custom features available are endless and are updated automatically! Cloud computing is much more productive because it frees you from the burden of maintaining a traditional computer. The on-board security makes it virtually impervious to malware or viruses. I highly recommend the 3G model for those dead zones and it does an excellent job switching when wi-fi is available. I can carry this device all day because it is very,very light! Despite its compact size,the keyboard is very generous even with my X-Large hands!

Reviews.Title: Student Review, Great Tool
Reviews.Author: raph
Reviews.Content: I love this handy dandy little notebook. I literally live on the cloud. Its light and easy to carry around, I've been using it for about 2 months and it has kept it's charge of around 6hrs well. I use it every day with no problems, although google's app selection for it doesn't have stuff you'd like it to have its more of a productive tool which google does have a lot of productivity apps. My only thought is that this is not a replacement for an actually laptop, this is a tool to carry with you while your 1,000$ laptop sits at home so no one steals it. The real question you should ask yourself is how often do spend your time online? for me it was about 99.9% so this chromebook literally fit every qualification i needed it to. It's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Simple, easy, malware-resistant, but cheap flimsy hardware
Reviews.Author: Nate Hartmann
Reviews.Content: I bought four of these for four girls, ages 12-16. They are mostly used for video chatting, watching videos, and doing Khan Academy exercises (in addition to general-purpose web browsing, of course).The Chromebooks are easy to use, and it's very convenient that they're tied to their google accounts - any girl can log in on any Chromebook and still see their own bookmarks, Google Docs, etc.Setup was trivially easy, and I liked that I could "power wash" them to reset them to factory condition before handing them out.Battery life is good. 6-8 hours of use from a single charge, at least initially.The non-standard keyboards took some getting used to, but are a good decision in hindsight (removing seldom-used function keys, instead replacing them with brightness/volume/etc).I would not buy one for myself, unless I was going to dual-boot with Ubuntu. There are a few things I need to do daily that can't be done in a web browser.Edit: After almost a year, one of these has a broken charging jack, and another has a smashed screen from a one meter drop. Although the Chrome OS is still going strong, I probably would not buy this model again. Accordingly, I have reduced my initial five-star review to three.

Reviews.Title: Great value, requires some set up
Reviews.Author: James C. Kraft "Moped Enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: Out of the box, it is a chrome web browser with a laptop built around it, which is fine, but I had expected that the offline mode would be functional immediately. You have to actually download some apps and enable offline mode in Drive, and it takes a little figuring out to get that done if you are used to traditional desktop and windows pc's. You also don't access your onboard storage in the same way as with a traditional pc - it works more like a web browser than the usual computer directory tree. Having gotten it set up, though, it's a great, zippy laptop; startup is instantaneous; great battery life. An absolute steal for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Darlene B.
Reviews.Content: Personal use. The laptop was a great deal. Love everything about it. Love it, love it, love it. Would recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: Great little Sammy!
Reviews.Author: A. Trussell "gr8taste"
Reviews.Content: I love my notebook! I have had great response form customer support all the way through! I was stuck in Amsterdam and Helsinki for days and if it were not for this little gem I would still be there! It works great with the European adapter as well. It comes on quickly and the built in protection is awesome! So much so that you really have to finagle around to get free wifi in hotels and things but it comes right up.
